strIntroduction: There are so many sightseeing spots in Tokyo that it is hard to choose where to go when you do not have much time. However, a bus tour can solve the problem. It takes you from the historical places to a fancy shopping mall. Within a limited time, you can see the many faces of Tokyo and have a fulfilled day. Itinerary: -Pick-up at select Tokyo hotels or Check-in at Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal -Departure from Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal (at 9:00) -Visit Meiji Shrine, the Shinto shrine built for the deified spirits of Emperor Meiji and Empress. The forest around the shrine was created about 100 years ago, and 100,000 trees were planted by volunteers. Located in the heart of Tokyo, yet Meiji Shrine gives habitats to many wild animals. -Drive by National Diet Building, the equivalent of a parliament building -Visit the Imperial Palace East Gardens. Edo Castle’s innermost circles of defense, Honmaru and Ninomaru used to exist there. Enjoy a stroll on a big lawn and watch Japanese style gardens with seasonal flowers. You will be amazed by the contrast between high buildings surrounding the palace and a traditional scenery. -Visit Sensoji Temple and Nakamise Shopping Street. Asakusa is a typical downtown area where you can feel an old time atmosphere of Tokyo. There are a number of shops lining in front of Sensoji Temple, which sells local treats and unique souvenirs. After enjoying shopping or trying sweet delights, head to Sensoji Temple, which is the most popular landmark in Tokyo. Do not forget to take pictures before a big red lantern of the Kaminarimon Gate! -Enjoy lunch overlooking Hamarikyu Gardens. Eat a Western-style lunch at the restaurant in the Seaside Hotel Shiba Yayoi. You can enjoy breathtaking views of Tokyo Bay and Japanese traditional garden, Hama-rikyu. *Lunch menu is subject to change. A vegetarian option is available, please let us know when booking. -Enjoy Tokyo Bay Cruise. Get aboard a luxurious ferry, “Symphony” for a cruise around Tokyo Bay area. -Visit Aqua City Odaiba famous for its futuristic architectures and big shopping malls. -Drive across the Rainbow Bridge whose colorful lights enhance a romantic mood at night. -Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal (drop off available) -Tour ends upon arrival at Tokyo Station around 17:30 (Marunouchi South Exit) Tour Availability: Every day from May to July 2016
strTitle: Panoramic Tokyo Bus Tour with Lunch and Bay Cruise

strIntroduction: After a long walk and tour around the city, how about a relaxing, romantic cruise to end your day? Come join us for an hour-long cruise at Tokyo Bay. The cruise usually starts from 9:30pm, but sometimes the cruise starts from 9:00 (please inquire before booking if you can only make 9:30pm). Simply meet at the yacht club 30 minutes prior for check-in! You can come after you tour around Tokyo, or after a hard day's work. You can enjoy a nice drink at the bar counter, and we serve many types of drinks from alcohol to non-alcohol. Take your drink up to the top deck of the ship, and feel the breeze while you gaze into the night view of Tokyo. Sit around in the seats and have a delightful conversation with your partner or friends, and make this the most memorable moment of your stay in Tokyo. Enjoy this luxurious experience with your favorite person, friends, or family.
strTitle: Tokyo Bay Night Cruise

strIntroduction: Gion, the centuries old entertainment district, truly comes alive at night. We take you on a walk through the old tea house district, explain the customs of the geisha and apprentice maiko and help you discover this hidden world. Here we might even have a chance to catch a few of the girls in full costume rushing off to an appointment. A special sight indeed. As we walk through these narrow streets with the lanterns flickering on the wooden buildings you can feel the charm of this special place. Wandering along these cobbled streets we will also take you to some places with a truly remarkable atmosphere. A night visit to a shrine, a full pagoda all lit up and other places of historic importance will leave an impression on you that you will never forget. But this is not just a place for the entertainers of old, it also has a thriving nightlife. After a long stroll it’s now time to enjoy a refreshing drink at a local pub with big bay windows. From here we can look out at the hostess clubs girls, bouncers and patrons all spilling out to the streets while we talk about the unique customs of Japanese nightlife of days old and new.
strTitle: Go on a Gion Night Walk, Kyoto

strIntroduction: Tokyo is one of the most famous gourmet cities in the world. It is the famous Tsukiji Market, with a total area of 230,000 m2, that makes this possible. On the basis of "visiting rules" established by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, one of the guides in our group will show participants around the market, safely in a small group of 4 or less exploring both the vegetable and fruit sections and the impressive seafood section. Especially attractive are the more than 480 different kinds of seafood on display in the seafood section ranging from fresh fish, to shell fish and prawns. There may also be an opportunity to see a complete tuna being cut and filleted. In Tsukiji Market, active shopkeepers and craftsmen work their traditional skills and way of life daily. Guests on this experience will also enjoy browsing various kinds of shops selling fish, vegetables, nori (dried seaweed), and dried seafood in the outer market. Since shoppers are buying direct from intermediate wholesalers in the inner market the volume of food and ingredients is substantially larger, often sold by the kilo. Our guide will be happy to pick you up if you book the hotel pickup option. Please note your transfer costs will be payable on the day - the pickup add-on option covers your guide's time and expenses for meeting and guiding you to the market. You can choose taxi, or Tokyo's excellent rail system. Tsukiji Market is basically divided into 2 areas- the Inside and the Outside market. The inside market is usually more entertaining and visitors can see the actual wholesale of the seafood. This part of the market opens to the public at 10:00, therefore we recommend to start the tour around 9:45 am. However, starting time can be flexible and you are free to suggest alternatives when you book the tour. Please note that if your group consists of more than 5 people, you might be split in two different groups. Tsukiji Fish Market is closed every Sunday and on the following days: Closed Dates in 2016: January 1, 2, 4, 11, 20, 27 February 3, 11, 17, 24 March 2, 9, 16, 21 April 6, 13, 20, 29 May 3, 4, 5, 11, 25 June 1, 8, 15, 22 July 13, 18, 27 August 11, 15, 16, 24 September 14, 19, 22, 28 October 5, 10, 19, 26 November 3, 9, 16, 23 December 7, 23, 31
strTitle: Tsukiji Fish Market Private Walking Tour (9:45am~)

strIntroduction: *PLEASE FEEL FREE TO ASK ME THE AVAILABILITY OF THE TOUR! I have this tour mainly 4th of Wednesday, but I can arrange the schedule on Monday(morning / afternoon), Thursday afternoon, and some Weekend. I'm very flexible! :) ＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝ In this tour, you'll enjoy the beauty of old Japanese houses, better understand sake brewing culture, sample many different types of sake, dine on traditional Japanese food, and purchase unique sake souvenirs! Time schedule: 10:00am - Meet at Hanshin Mikage station Walk to the breweries We visit 2-3 breweries at the tour (depends on the day and time). See the museum, free tasting sake and shopping 1:45pm - break up at Hanshin Uozaki station ================================ First we will go to the Hakutsuru Brewery Museum. Hakutsuru（白鶴） is one of the most famous sake brands in Japan and the world. You can see various sake production instruments on display, including a huge vat made of Japanese cedar once used for fermentation. After the museum tour, you can take some pictures wearing happi and epron (traditional attire for sake brewers), taste several kinds of fresh sake in the tasting room, and buy souvenirs, including sake exclusively sold only at the brewery museum. After the Hakutsuru Brewery Museum, we will go to another sake brewery, Kikumasamune and Hamafukutsuru. You can taste about 7 different types of sake at the brewery for free, and then buy some sake after that! You can choose Japanese cuisine or Awaji beef for lunch. The cost is between 1300 to 2000 yen. Feel free for asking me about your food preferences and allergies. We will then drop you off at Hanshin Uozaki station. ＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝ 日本でも有名な灘の酒蔵を2‐3か所回り、伝統的な酒つくりや現在の醸造の様子、とても複雑で奥深い醸造プロセスなどを、展示物やビデオなどでわかりやすく体験していただけます。 醸造プロセスをきちんと説明させていただいたうえで、たくさんの種類を試飲していただきますので、その違いが日本酒になじみのない外国人の方々でもくっきりとわかる、ということで、多くの参加者の方に高評価をいただいております。 以前灘の酒蔵エリアの近くに住んでいた時に、夫と一緒にこのエリアの酒蔵を歩いて制覇した経験があるので、このエリアの酒蔵については熟知しています。 その日のスケジュールに応じて、それぞれの酒蔵の特徴をしっかりつかんだ、魅力的なツアー行程を柔軟に組ませていただきます。 またランチも日本食、淡路ビーフなど、いくつかのオプションをご用意できます。予算は1000円から2000円です。 開催スケジュールは特にカレンダーに入れておりませんが、基本的に第4水曜開催できます。また月曜（午前または午後）、木曜午後、金曜午後にも開催可能です。詳しくはお気軽にお問合わせください。柔軟に対応させていただきます！
strTitle: Kobe: Explore the Sake Breweries

strIntroduction: In this activity you will dress in a gorgeous kimono and walk around Tokyo's Bonsai Museum, enjoying the garden and the beautiful bonsai art. You can take photos both inside the museum and in the garden. As an add-on option you can book a traditional tea ceremony too! This activity is available every day from 10:00 to 16:00. The house is located in East Tokyo, near Koiwa or Mizue stations, about 30 minutes away by train and city bus from Akihabara station.
strTitle: Wear a Kimono at a traditional house in the Bonsai Museum

strIntroduction: The tour will start at our Guest House very early in the morning, but there is a reason for that. The auction starts at 5:00 am in the morning, and it only allows 120 visitors per day. They do not take any reservations...so we’ll need to get to the fish market early and wait in line to get tickets. So for the tour, we’ll depart at 3:00 am and get to the fish market around 3:30 am, then wait in line. During the waiting time the guide will provide you with a wide variety of information about Japanese food and culture. Detailed Itinerary; The night before the day Check in our Guest House which is located in Tsukiji Market. 3:30 am Gather at lobby of "Guesthouse" 4:00 am Start Tsukiji Market Tour 5:25 am Start Tuna Auction 6:00 am Walk around the market 6:30 am Breakfast 7:45 am End of the tour *Because the meeting time is early in the morning, you may not be able to use public transportation. We strongly suggest tour participants to stay in our guest house (overnight stay is included in the price) Breakfast at Tsukiji Market: Tsukiji's Sushi Restaurant offers Pacific bluefin tuna and wild white fish. Many of the restaurants operate with more than 10 intermediate wholesalers. That’s why Tsukiji Sushi restaurant is able to assess and purchase the best seafood everyday. Fish from the market are quickly prepared for customers. Please enjoy the taste of real and fresh seafood!
strTitle: See the Tuna Auction on a Special Tour in Tsukiji Market!

strIntroduction: Maid Cafes were originally designed for male otaku, fans of anime, manga and video games. Waitresses at this coffee shop dress in maid costumes that remind animation fans of popular female characters. Everyone enjoys the make-believe atmosphere. Now Maid Cafes are loved by not only male otaku (anime or manga fans) but also by women and international tourist eager to see the exciting evolution of Japan’s modern culture. Maidreamin is located at Akihabara. It’s much like an entertainment café and bar. Once you enter Maidreamin, you’ll become almost a resident of the dream land. Waitresses treat you as ladies and gentlemen. You can also take a picture with the pretty waitresses dressing in costume. Let’s enjoy! It should be one of your special memories in Japan. Open hours Monday to Friday: 11:30 - 23:00 Weekends and Public Holidays: 10:30 - 23:00 Choose between several food options: ※Price※ Plan A: 1 hour Drink combo (1Drink + Commemorative photo) 1500yen Plan B: 1 hour Food combo (Omeletrice or Curryrice or Hamburg steak or Parfait or Cake + 1Drink + Commemorative photo+Souvenir) 2500yen Plan C: 2 hours Food combo (Omeletrice or Curryrice or Hamburg steak or Parfait or Cake + 1Drink + Commemorative photo+Souvenir+Maid Live) 3500yen
strTitle: Enjoy Maid Cafe Maidreamin in Akihabara

strIntroduction: On this tour you will explore: First stop will be Shibuya scramble crossing. See this notorious Tokyo area that was featured in the "Lost In Translation" starring Bill Murray and Scarlet Johanson. See the fashion and art trendsetting shops, walking three main street including Takeshita st., Harajuku st. and Cat street between Harajuku and Shibuya. And finally we'll reach a famous Shibuya crossing steet. Also I could arrange some shops according to your preference. For the ultimate "Kawai" destination, we will drop into the Cat Café or Maid Café. "Kawaii" is the Japanese word for cute, and you haven't experienced cute quite like this café. Play with some of the most adorable kittens and enjoy a beverage of choice. The tour will conclude with sushi! Not just any type of sushi but one of the most high tech chains. The entire process of ordering and delivering will be done automatically! No better way to end an amazing day than with this famous sushi chain!
strTitle: Harajuku - Shibuya Private Walking Tour

strIntroduction: Similar to what sommeliers do, “Kikizake” (sake tasting) is an activity that involves guessing what brand of sake you are served blindfolded. In this activity, you will... • You will chose 5 kinds of sake from 20~30 sake and enjoy the different tastes of each sake. If you like the sake you tasted, you can order it directly from its place of origin as well. Let us know if you have a particular preference for what type of sake you’d like to drink in advance so we can choose the sakes according to your taste. Sake varies in dryness (alcohol percentage) and can be served cold or warm. (Price includes the cost for 5 brands of Sake)
strTitle: Sake Tasting

strIntroduction: Experience a private authentic tea ceremony after you have visited the famous Golden Pavilion (Kinkakuji) in Kyoto! In only 45 minutes you will attend the following: 1. Introduction to the roots of tea ceremony in Japan: The spirit of Chado, utensils, and history. 2. Watch a traditional ceremony performed by a lecturer of Urasenke, which is one of the most famous tea schools in Japan. I provide seasonal tea utensils that will help you enjoy the Japanese four seasons. 3. Have traditional Japanese sweets and learn how to make your own powdered green tea. Use traditional utensils to make powdered green tea by yourself. Special fresh sweets often served in Real tea ceremonies in Kyoto will be prepared for Voyagin guests! In addition, you can take free photos in the vestibule, decorated with kimono and traditional Nishijin textile and Japanese paintings. Please choose from the following available times for this activity: - 11:45～12:30 - 13:00～13:45 - 14:15～15:00 - 15:30～16:15 - 16:45～17:30 This activity is available everyday except Sundays, the 1st and 3rd Wednesday of each month, and the 2nd and 4th Saturday of each month. Option: Kimono Wearing & Tea Ceremony (Only women) Please choose from the following available times for this activity: Start： A9:00 or B11:00 (60-90min It depends on the number of people) Min 1 - Max 5 person Age: Required over 9 years old -You can wear Kimono and join tea ceremony. It includes introduction, 2 bowls of powdered green tea and sweets, and the experience to make powdered green tea by yourselves. You can take photos in a tea room as well as the waiting room with Japanese seasonal displays.
strTitle: Enjoy a Tea Ceremony with Special Sweets in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Spend some time petting and taking pictures with adorable owls at this owl cafe in Osaka. Owl cafes are a new type of themed cafe that are becoming increasingly popular all over Japan. Even if you don't think of yourself particularly as an owl lover, these adorable birds will surely steal your heart. Before meeting the owls, you'll have a chance to order a drink of your preference, before a member of the staff carefully explains the proper way to handle the owl to avoid any harm to you and the owl. Please listen attentively to their explanation so that you can enjoy an amazing time with the owls. Here is the flow of the experience: - enter the shop and hear the instructions of the staff (first 15 minutes of the experience) - spend time with the owls (for about 35 minutes) - end of the experience You'll then need to clean your hands with hand sanitizer before you can touch and pet the owls. After your time is up, you'll be able to visit the gift shop and find a unique owl-related souvenir! Other rules to observe: - only the staff can bring and take away the owls. - don't let go off the leash. - avoid touching the owls anywhere else except for their heads. - turn off the flash when taking a photo. This is definitely a rare, unique experience that you should definitely not miss while you are visiting Japan! Reserve your seat now! It is also possible to rent the entire place for 1 hour! Available for up to 20 people at once! The opening time of the cafe in Osaka is as follows: Weekday: 12:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Weekend: 11:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Closed: Mondays
strTitle: Reservation for Lovely Owl Cafe in Osaka

strIntroduction: In this activity, you will eat a delicious dinner at the samurai-themed, Sengoku era (Warring States era) restaurant in Shinjuku! Below is the special menu set that you can enjoy: - Assorted appetizers - Egg, cream cheese with pickles, seasoned cod roe - Duck with long green onion salad - Assorted sashimi - Assorted tempura - Steamed pork and chicken - Zaru-soba buckwheat noodles - Steamed egg custard with assorted ingredients - Dessert Some ingredients change according to the season. The izakaya is open under the following schedule: Mondays to Thursdays: 5:00pm to 0:00am Fridays, Saturdays, the days before national holidays: 5:00pm to 3:00am Sunday, National holidays: 5:00pm to 11:30pm Additionally, as an option you can book tickets to the Robot Restaurant show at a discounted price! The Robot Restaurant is located just 10 minutes away on foot from the izakaya restaurant. Below is the show schedule: *Show time is approx. 90 minutes 1. Doors open at 3:20pm Show starts at 4pm (on weekends and busy season only) 2. Doors open at 5:15pm Show starts at 5:55pm 3. Doors open at 7:10pm Show starts at 7:50pm 4. Doors open at 9:05pm Show starts at 9:45pm We recommend one of the following itineraries: Plan A Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 3:20pm → Show begins at 4:00pm → Show ends at 5:30pm Move to the restaurant → Dinner at 6:00pm for up to 120 minutes Plan B Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 5:15pm → Show begins at 5:55pm → Show ends at 7:25pm Move to the restaurant → Dinner at 8:00pm for up to 120 minutes Plan C Dinner at 5:00pm until 7:00pm Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 7:10pm → Show begins at 7:50 pm → Show ends at 9:20pm Plan D Dinner at 6:30pm until 8:30pm Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 9:05pm → Show begins at 9:45pm → Show ends at 11:15pm
strTitle: Sengoku-style Izakaya dinner with a Robot Restaurant Ticket

strIntroduction: Nikko, in Tochigi Prefecture, is the best destination to get away from Tokyo to know the other faces of Japan. Passing through the scenic countryside, this tour leads you to popular historic spots, such as Toshogu Shrine, Chuzenji Lake, and Kegon Falls. Just hop on a bus and enjoy strolling around the World Heritage Site! Itinerary: Pickup at select Tokyo hotels (07:30 – 09:00) Bus ride to Nikko (about 160 minutes) -Visit Nikko Toshogu Shrine, a mausoleum of 400 years old, deifying the founder of the Edo Shogunate, Tokugawa Ieyasu. There are 54 buildings decorated with pillars and vivid colors in the shrine. Keep in mind that 2016 is the year of the monkey. Do not miss watching the three wise monkeys at Shin-Kyusha that embodied the proverbial principle "see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil". Lunch (*Please choose a tour with or without lunch when you make reservation.) -Visit Lake Chuzenji created by an eruption of Mt. Nantai, and relax by a beautiful scenery and a fresh air. -Visit Kegon Falls, ranked in the three great waterfalls in Japan. The area is full of fresh green leaves in early summer and red leaves in autumn. You can feel negative ions that a spray of water gives off from a 97 meter height. -Drop off at Shinjuku Station or Ginza (19:00 – 20:00) Tour Availability: Sun, Tue, Thu, & Fri from May to July 2016
strTitle: Nikko and Kegon Falls World Heritage Bus Tour from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is a truly great coffee experience in Tokyo! Our cafe is located between Shibyua and Yokohama, near Motosumiyoshi Station on the Tokyu-Toyoko Line. In this activity, you can learn how to drip coffee in an authentic Japanese way. Once you've learned it, your future coffee experience will never be the same again. We promise that this is something you've never done before! We will meet directly at our cafe, or we can pick you up at Motosumiyoshi Station. Then, you can enjoy wonderful coffee experience for about 1hour 30mins with an expert teacher. Little groups of up to 4 people are best for this activity. Children are welcome too. In the end, you can take 100 grams of coffee beans home with you as a present. Enjoy your life with a cup of coffee!
strTitle: Learn how to drip the best coffee in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Hydrospeeding (or riverboard) is a river sports in which you speed down a river on a small body board raft. This is a thrilling experience that really allows you to feel the power of the water. Don't worry if you are not a confident swimmer, you will be wearing fins, a life jacket, and a helmet which makes it easier to control your board and stay afloat. Our experienced guides will teach you & support you during the entire duration of the experience. This experience is available during riverboard season 4/19-10/25 The tour time is about 3 hours which includes getting ready, transport to river, rafting, and chill out time whilst checking out the photo's from the tour.
strTitle: Riverboard/Hydrospeed in the Tama River

strIntroduction: Explore the amazing Tsukiji Fish Market in an entertaining tour with an experienced professional guide! Don't miss this opportunity to visit the world's largest fish market before it gets moved to a different location. Below is the itinerary for this tour: 9:00 am: Meet at the subway exit of the nearest subway station (the exact location will be provided after you book) 9:00 - 9:30am: Fruits and vegetables section 9:30am-9:40 am: Uogashi yokocho 9:50am - 10:30am: Fish market(Tsukiji inner market) 10:30am-11:00am: Tsukiji outer market ※If you have a child in your group please let me know in advance. Important rules to observe while exploring the market: Tsukiji is a business market, so visitors should be very aware of their surroundings and be sure to step out of the way of workers on fast-moving turrets or in the narrow aisles of the inner market. - Do not obstruct traffic. - Do not bring large bags or suitcases into the market. - Do not enter the market in high heeled shoes or sandals. - Do not bring small children or pets. - Do not smoke in the market. - Do not touch any of the fish. The various types of fresh fish and other seafood from around the world, combined with the bustling atmosphere created by intermediate wholesalers and various vehicles whizzing around have given the market a unique ambiance. However, it has been scheduled to be relocated to Toyosu. Then visitors will no longer be able to walk among the colorful and dizzying seafood stalls. The new location will instead have a viewing area overlooking the wholesaler's area（nakaoroshi）so now is your best chance to see the market from a close distance! Tsukiji Fish Market is closed every Sunday and on the following days: Closed Dates in 2016: July 13, 17, 18, 24, 27, 31 August 7,11,14,15,16,21,24,28 September 4,11,14,18,19,22,25,28 October 2,5,9,10,16,19,23,26,30 November 3,6,9,13,16,20,23,27 December 4,7,11,18,23,31
strTitle: 50% OFF Explore Tsukiji Fish Market in a fun local tour!

strIntroduction: Ever dreamed of becoming a Bushido master (samurai)? Through this trip, you can meet a bushido master and learn life lessons from them. If you want to feel the spirit of Japan, this is the trip you are looking for. The dojo you are visiting is called "Ryuseikan" and it is very accessible from major cities in Tokyo (Shibuya, Shinjuku etc.) We will meet up at our office that is 10 minutes walk from Harajuku Station at 1:00 PM and move to the destination by car. Once we get to the temple, a bushido master will be your guide for the day. The number of participants is limited to 8 people, so hospitable service is ensured for each participant! There will be a translator to help you communicate so don't worry about a language barrier! You will spend around 3 to 4 hours at the dojo (Japanese training hall) doing different activities you've never experienced before. Details of the 4-hour bushido experience trip During this experience, you will: 1. First, prepare human-like decoys made of tatami straw that will be used as the opponent when practicing and fighting with a "katana," orJapanese sword. 2. Next, wet the straw decoy to symbolize the blood of a living opponent 3. Practice how to bow and move like a samurai 4. Use the wooden sword provided by the master to practice ‘kata,’ standard sword fighting posture 5. Advance to a metal, unsharpened sword to familiarize yourself with the feel of what it would be like to wield a real samurai sword 6. And, lastly, practice holding a real sword, face your wet straw opponent, and feel the sensation and power of your sword slicing through the air just like in movies! Not only that you can experience a Bushido lesson, you can also talk to locals and hear their life stories. After the trip, we will head back to Harajuku Station and finish the day.
strTitle: Spend half a day with a Bushido Master in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Sapporo city, the capital of Hokkaido, is one of the famous tourist spots in Japan - approximately 20 million of foreign visitors came to here in 2015. Most of the famous activities they enjoyed were generally shopping, visiting famous tourist spot, and having flesh Hokkaido cuisine. We would like to provide additional selection into Hokkaido tourism. That’s local Hokkaido experience! The itinerary is below: 10:00- we meet up at west side of north gate at Sapporo Station, or pick up at your hotel 10:30- arrive at the bottom of the mountain and begin hiking 12:00- lunch time, you can choose your favorite meal from several restaurant we have selected 14:00- we give you a ride to your hotel or Sapporo Station *This tour is held every Sunday during June 1st to September 30! 【3 courses you can select!】 ★Beginner’s Course (60 minutes walking) Climbing up to Okurayama (Okura Mountain). There are wooden steps, easy to climb up. On the top of Okurayama, you can grab a delicious ice cream for 350 yen. ★★Middle Course (80 minutes walking) Climbing up to Sankakuyama (Sankaku Mountain). Sankakuyama is higher and tougher than Okurayama. On the way to the top of the mountain, there are two ways, steep way and gentle slope. There are some dangerous spots that you should hands to grab a rock, but you can see beautiful view from the summit of Sankakuyama. ★★★Higher Course (180 minutes walking) Climbing two mountains, Sankakuyama and Okuayama! Both mountains are connected by a mountain trail. Enter from Sankakuyama, and climb up to the top. After that go to Okurayama. This course is the hardest and most dangerous in my tour, but this challenging experience must give you great sense of accomplishment. Please don’t worry! I support your safety as much as I can. ____________________________________________ FAQ: Q1: What if it will be rainy day? →Have a lamb barbecue (Genghis Khan BBQ) in Okurayama restaurant and enjoy view of Sapporo. Q2: How flexible is the tour? →Super flexible. As long as we can, we make suggestions for the best experience for your trip. If you want to do BBQ, we take you to the best park for BBQ, or if you want to go to seaside, we can take you to Otaru or Zenibako area. Q3: I’m alone. Can I join this tour? →Yes you can! From 1 person to 6 people can join this tour! Q4: How many guides are coming with us on this tour? →2 to 4 guides. It depends on the number of participants. All the guides are very friendly and good at English. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask us!
strTitle: Enjoy hiking and get great coffee at the summit of Sapporo!

strIntroduction: Why don't you wear a Kimono and have lunch at an old Japanese house, which was built 130 years ago? Maruyama-cho Wadatsumi is a reproduced building of Okiya, which was a house for entertainers to stand-by before their show. Although Shibuya is a city for young generation, once you step into Wadatsumi, it feels like you've transported to Edo period! Wear a Kimono at the venue and take photos at traditional Japanese building. For lunch, you can enjoy either mini sushi set or Japanese Wagyu beef while watching the fascinating view of the gorgeous garden. The photo shooting earns high satisfaction from the guests! There are special highlights only for this activity! 1) Choose your favorite Kimono! -When you enter the restaurant Wadatsumi, choose your favorite Kimono (or Yukata during June - September) which you would like to try it on. 2) Experience photo shooting and keep your memory! -You can experience photo shooting at the corridor so that you can keep it as an unforgettable memory. Photos will be given to you after the meal! 3) Enjoy delicious Japanese cuisine! -You can either select from Himenigiri, 24 kinds of mini Sushi lunch, or Japanese Wagyu Beef Hitsumabushi Gozen. 4) Purchase your favorite Kimono at valuable price! -If you really like your Kimono which you wore at the activity, you can even purchase them at valuable price, 5000 JPY! There are no other places where you can buy Kimono at this price! Wear a Kimono and experience lunch program in the Japanese atmosphere! strIntroduction: From the ancient times human beings searched for water for their survival. Here in Japan, shaman women went to water for purification, rejuvenation and inspiration. In this 3-hour session, you will visit a sacred waterfall whose historical record goes back to more than a thousand years ago. Tapping into the tradition of water and sun rituals of Japan, you will be led to create your own ritual for your healing, rejuvenation and discovery based on traditional Japanese dance and the method of the Expressive Arts Therapy. Art supplies will be provided for this experience. Please wear comfortable clothing.
strTitle: Practice Spiritual Water Dance Healing in Kyoto

strIntroduction: - - - Tour Overview - - - Visit Tsukiji Market for about one hour with English-speaking tour guide and then move on to the ABC Cooking Studio (only 5 minutes away by taxi), Japan's largest cooking school, where you will make Japanese meals together. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - *Tsukiji Market* Tsukiji is not only about 'Fish" but also about 'local market' where the locals come to buy their daily ingredients. strIntroduction: If you are a true big fan of Japanese traditional art and culture, you definitely shouldn’t miss this incredible tour program! This tour program will take you to an Atelier in Asakusa, Tokyo, where you can enjoy experiencing the traditional Japanese dye methods for clothes. You can use several method for clothes dying, such as squeeze dyeing, wax drawing or templates dyeing to dye the clothes. Squeeze dyeing is the traditional and the intuitive dyeing technique that uses various tools and folded clothes. Wax drawing is a method that draws the patterns directly on clothes by using brushes and melted wax. Template dyeing is a technique that damps the template with exclusive paste made by natural ingredients. The flow of the clothes dyeing experience will be as follows: - Choose clothes that you want - Make your designs using rubber bands and marbles - Select the desired colors - Dye your clothes - Dry your clothes This tour program everyday except on Wednesdays from 10:00 - 19:00. You can try dyeing on towel, handkerchief, stole, t-shirt, lunch bag, tote bag, or Y-shirt. Please refer to the available course for pricing. Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles!
strTitle: Enjoy Dyeing Experience at an Atelier in Asakusa, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Takoyaki literally means "fried octopus," tako means octopus and yaki means fried and is a small ball-shaped Japanese dish made out of a wheat flour-based batter and cooked in a special moulded pan. Takoyaki tastes a little bit like Okonomiyaki in a ball shape but it has a much different flavor from the tako (octopus) cooked inside them. In most parts of Japan, people do not treat takoyaki as a meal. Many people typically think of takoyaki as something to buy from street vendors at festivals and events. In western Japan, in the Kansai area on the other hand, takoyaki is very popular not only as a snack but also as a meal. With this experience you can experience making takoyaki, an opportunity you cannot miss followed by the opportunity to eat the takoyaki you make. East Inc. offers a takoyaki making workshop in Fukuoka and the class is held just a 2 minute walk from JR/Subway Hakata Station and don’t worry, this class is suitable for complete beginners! If you do not like octopus, you can change it to other ingredients such as sausage, cheese, mochi or mentaiko. These are the activity details: Course: 90 minutes, Includes making and tasting 10 pieces of takoyaki. Reception hours: Every day 11:00 – /12:00 – /13:00 –
strTitle: Learn How to Make Takoyaki in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: Sushi, Tempura, and Sukiyaki are not the only Japanese foods! You can try more and more and more great tasty Japanese foods! Do you like to eat and learn how to prepare it? strIntroduction: The wide Ise Bay south of Nagoya is encircled by Ise-Shima region on Mie prefecture's side and Atsumi peninsula on Aichi prefecture's side. In this pleasant day trip from Nagoya you will visit the wonderful Mikimoto Pearl Island and museum in Ise-Shima before crossing the bay by the gorgeous sightseeing cruise boat. You will arrive at Irago on Atsumi peninsula and have a delicious lunch followed by a hot spring and spa in a luxurious hotel with a panorama view over the bay. After this delightful experience you will be able to choose between returning back to Ise-Shima with the romantic sunset cruise or reaching Nagoya by taxi through Atsumi peninsula while stopping for seasonal fruit picking along the way. The options of this day trip make it possible for couples and families to participate by customizing the itinerary according to their needs. Enjoy one wonderful day around Ise Bay! Below is the itinerary for this trip. Option 1 is recommended for families with children, while Option 2 is recommended for couples: 7:00 am (recommended starting time) - leave Kintetsu Nagoya Station by limited express train and go to Toba Station (about 100 minutes) 9:00 am - visit Mikimoto Pearl Museum in Toba and learn more about the history of Japan's pearl cultivation which originated in the end of the 19th century. Nowadays the Mikimoto-branded pearls are world-famous and at the museum you can see a special performance of female divers Ama who still dive in the sea for oysters. 10:40 am or 10:50 pm - ride the Ise Bay ferry from Toba port, a few hundred meters south of the pearl museum. The pleasant sightseeing cruise takes about an hour to reach Irago on Atsumi peninsula. 12:00 - get picked up from Irago and go to Irago View Hotel, a luxurious accommodation facility where you will eat a gorgeous lunch and have relaxing time in the hot spring and spa center. The hot spring offers a commanding view over the bay! From this point you can choose between Option 1 and Option 2. Option 1: Meet your guide at the hotel and go by taxi to a rural farm in the middle of Atsumi peninsula. You can enjoy seasonal fruit picking: strawberries in winter and spring, and melons in summer! After that your taxi will take you to Toyohashi Station where the tour will end. Option 2: Return to Toba port by the sunset cruise of Ise Bay ferry (the time depends on the season). The tour ends at Toba Station. Note: This is a self-guided tour unless you choose Option 1. In that case there will be a guide for the second half of the day at Atsumi peninsula. Enjoy the beautiful nature and the wide ocean on this relaxing day trip to one of the most charming destinations in rural Japan!
strTitle: Cross the Ise Bay on a gorgeous cruise, day trip from Nagoya

strIntroduction: Nagano prefecture is widely known as the home of the Japanese Alps and the host of the Winter Olympics in 1998. This one day tour will take you to some of the highlights in the northern part of the prefecture. You can take the tour anytime, but the most scenic views you can see during the winter when the snowy landscape creates an unforgettable experience! Don't miss a chance to visit some of Japan's most famous mountain sightseeing spots! IMPORTANT: Between April and November this tour is only offered on a private guided basis. Do note that there is no snow during that period. You can still see the monkeys in the park. It is possible to request some changes to the itinerary for a private tour (please make an enquiry in advance). There are two types of group tour: starting from Tokyo (Shinkansen bullet train round-trip tickets included) and starting from Nagano (Shinkansen bullet train round-trip tickets not included). The schedule is the same for all types of tours. The one day tour's itinerary is as follows: 7:50- 8:30 - take Shinkansen from Tokyo Station (on your own for private tour and group tour starting from Nagano) 9:10 - 10:00 - arrive at Nagano Station and meet your guide 10:30 -12:00 - take a walk around Zenkoji Temple, the biggest and most famous temple in Nagano city, known for the first Buddhist statue in Japan. Zenkoji Temple is one of the oldest temples in Japan and is designated as a national treasure. 12:30 -13:30 - take a train to Yudanaka Onsen, a picturesque old hot spring town, from where you will take a 30-minute walking trail to Jigokudani Monkey Park 13:30 - 14:00 - arrive at Kanbayashi Onsenguchi near Yudanaka Onsen station and take a stroll to Jigokudani Monkey Park 14:00 -15:00 - enjoy the unique view of the monkeys bathing in a natural hot spring! In winter the entire pool is covered with snow and you will be amazed by the adorable faces of the soaking monkeys! 15:00 - 15:30 - take a walk back to Kanbayashi Onsenguchi 15:30 - 16:30 - take a train from Yudanaka Onsen back to Nagano Station 16:30 -17:30 - Take the Shinkansen from Nagano back to Tokyo. 18:30 -19:30 - Arrive back at Tokyo Station. Lunch is included in the group tour (after your stroll around Zenkoji Temple). ・Please give us the age and gender, and name for all participants when you make a booking. ・Also, please give us your hotel information (hotel name, hotel reservation name) so we can send you your confirmation papers. ・Let us know any meal preference if you may have. ・Please provide us homeowner's name, homeowner's address, homeowner's number and check-in date if you are staying at a private residence. We will contact the homeowner for ticket delivery. ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We require at least 3 full business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if you do not provide us your hotel information at least 3 full business days prior your ticket date, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. - If your hotel reservation details change, please tell us immediately through the Voyagin dashboard. - We only deliver to hotels with a concierge with whom we can confirm the receipt of the ticket delivery. We do not deliver tickets to hostels, guesthouses, or private residences. Please let us know if you are not staying at a hotel so we can provide our office details for you to pickup the tickets. 2. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station. Address: (English) Miyamasu ON Building 5th floor, 1-15-8 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo (Japanese) 〒150-0002 東京都渋谷区渋谷 1-15-8 宮益 ON ビル 5F Detailed Directions (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/shibuya-station-to-voyagin-office Google Map (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/voyagin-google-map

strIntroduction: Handa city in Aichi prefecture is famous for Japanese sake. The city is located near the Chubu International Airport. strIntroduction: Saihō-ji is a Rinzai Zen Buddhist temple located in Matsuo, Nishikyō Ward, Kyoto, Japan. The temple, which is famed for its moss garden, is commonly referred to as "Koke-dera", meaning "moss temple", while the formal name is "Kōinzan Saihō-ji". The temple, primarily constructed to honor Amitabha, was first founded by Gyōki and was later restored by Musō Soseki. In 1994, Saihō-ji was registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, as part of the "Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto". Until 1977, Saihō-ji was open to admission to the general public on a walk-up basis, as with other temples. At present, while it is open to the public, a number requirements limit the number of visitors. It is said that these regulations were put into place to protect the delicate moss from the hordes of tourists that plagued the temple before 1977. They prefer for the application to arrive up to 7 working days before the intended visit; there is only one visit per day, with time varying, so time of visit cannot be specified. The fee to visit (¥3,000) is the highest in Kyoto. Visitor are given access to the grounds for 90 minutes. Before being permitted access to the garden, visitors must engage in an activity, which varies from day to day. These include zazen (sitting meditation), hand copying sutras (shakyō), and chanting sutras. One is then asked to write down one's wish, name, and address. The monks keep all the sutras in the pagoda and continue to pray for all. The most famous times to visit are either during the East Asian rainy season (in Kyoto, early June to mid-July), when the rains make the moss particularly lush, or in late autumn, when the turning leaves contrast with the moss. ※Reservation is required 2 weeks in advance. ※This tour includes reservation from the temple and interpretation of the tour.
strTitle: Tour Saihō-ji (Moss Temple), a UNESCO World Heritage Site

strIntroduction: The Yoshiwara quarter was established in Tokyo in the 17th century, and grew into a self-contained district offering all manners of entertainment. Among the women living within this quarter the oiran (courtesans) were the most prominent, chosen by the wealthiest and most powerful citizens as entertainers. Oiran were masters of entertainment, skilled in sado (tea ceremony), ikebana (flower arranging) and calligraphy, among other cultural arts. Experience a colorful representation of ancient Japan with this elaborate oiran show, ideal for both new and repeat visitors to Japan! - Performance Date Saturday & Sunday Only - Show Schedule Open 15:45, Show Starts 16:30 (30 min) Close 17:00 Duration: 1 hour Pick-up: Not available Inclusion: Show fee /Green tea (Cold)/Crackers Please do not arrive before the check-in time, as you will not be able to enter the theater. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before the show starts. Closest Train Station ・Oedo Line or Hibiya Line's Roppongi Station (Exit 3 or 5)

strIntroduction: The temple you are visiting is called "Honkouji" and it is around 1 hour drive from Tokyo. We will meet up in front of Hachiko statue at Shibuya station at 12:30 PM and move to the destination by car. Once we get to the temple, a monk will be your guide for the day. The number of participants is limited to 8 people, so hospitable service is ensured for each participant! There will be a translator to help you communicate so don't worry about a language barrier! You will spend around 3 to 4 hours at a temple doing different activities you've never experienced before. The activities include Japanese calligraphy making, matcha making. You also get to sit down and ask monks any questions you have! After the trip, we will head back to Harajuku Station and go back to Tokyo's city life.

strIntroduction: Shodo is a type of traditional Japanese art style that uses brushes and ink to write "Kanji", or other Chinese characters. In the world of Shodo every single character has its own meaning and how you write the character expresses your feeling or your thought in what you write. In this lesson, you'll have the opportunity to create your own unique Japanese souvenir by writing your name in Kanji on a t-shirt, a Japanese fan, or another item of your choice. Don’t miss this opportunity if you want to experience real Japanese culture!! In this activity you will... • Learn about the background and history of Japanese Calligraphy. • Practice basic brush techniques and composition. • Learn how to write a letter(s) of your choice in Chinese characters ("Kanji") • Choose a souvenir type and write your name on it so you can take it home with you!
strTitle: Create your own Unique Souvenir: Japanese Calligraphy

strIntroduction: Ikebana may seem like a simple style of flower arrangement, but in reality, it's an authentic Japanese art through which locals appreciate the beauty of simplicity. Everything is taken into consideration to the smallest detail, including the size and shape of the flowers, trunks, leaves and branches. Ikebana is often falsely regarded as an art form reserved for women, however, traditionally ikebana used to be a required "mannerism" for well-educated man. Since you came all this way to visit a "strange" island, it would be a waste NOT to experience our genuinely unique culture! 1. In this course you will first be introduced to essential knowledge about ikebana and the history of its development. 2. After listening to the instruction, you'll learn the basic concepts of ikebana, allowing you to grasp an image for your own work. 3. And then it`s finally your turn: Try to create an ikebana art work by your self! Don't worry, we'll give you a hand when you need it. Monday, Wednesday, Friday 10:00am (75-90 min) Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday 4:00pm (75-90in)
strTitle: Experience the art of Ikebana in Gion, Kyoto

strIntroduction: "Taiko" is a Japanese drum that can be heard playing its bold and earth shaking sound at many festivals here in Tokyo. Even from a distance, the sound of Taiko can be heard and felt. In this activity, you will learn how to play Taiko from a professional teacher who has played Taiko for almost 30 years. He has performed world wide and is very knowledgeable. This activity includes lessons of other musical instruments like the Takebue (flute constructed of bamboo) as well. No prior experience or knowledge is required to join this activity. I can sometimes meet special requests, but our regular class times are: Tue, Fri (19:00 - 20:30) Thu (10:30 - 12:00) Sun (12:30 - 14:00) If you would like a private class, please book the anytime class options. *Closed on Wed & Sat LOCATION: About 10 minutes walk from Ryogoku station, which is served by the JR East Chūō-Sōbu Line and the Toei Oedo Line. It is numbered as station E-12.
strTitle: Learn to Play the Taiko in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: The 2-hour duration of this unique Nihonga pigment painting workshop is ample even for beginners to produce a finished work of art. The classes are semi-private and special attention will be paid to your work. Of course, you can take the art you create home as a souvenir! I will provide the necessary materials so you don't have to worry about it. You will learn and use painting methods that are different from popular water colour or oil techniques. We'll use Japanese pigment, sumi ink, brushes, Washi paper, and an uchiwa fan. I can provide sample images for painting, but if you wish to make your own design, please bring sketches or photos. Nihonga Pigments: ground minerals mined from various places around the world. They are expensive than normal pigments For other times, please ask in advance. Please note that young children under the age of 12 are not allowed to join this workshop.
strTitle: Learn Japanese pigment painting in a Nihonga workshop

strIntroduction: This is an unbelievable 1-day bus tour that takes you to: - see Mt Fuji and drive up to the 5th Station at 2,300 meters above sea level - experience the authentic Japanese hot spring bathing ritual at Lake Yamanaka Onsen - shop with discounts at the Gotemba Premium Outlets Tour details: Your day starts at 9 am when you meet your guide at Shinjuku. Ride on a comfortable private coach towards Mt Fuji. It is 100km (60 miles) to the Gotemba 5th Station, a famous viewing area high on the slopes. Mt Fuji, Japan’s highest peak, looms overhead, at 3,776 meters (12,389 feet). You can walk around and admire the incredible views across the plains and up high towards the summit. Your guide explains the history and significance of this revered mountain. It has inspired many poets, painters and pilgrims over the centuries. More than 200,000 climbers start their ascent here, from this 5th station, to the summit every year. The elevation can be chilly even in summer, it is best to bring a sweater of light jacket. On some days in winter and spring, the road might be to icy to reach the 5th station itself. On these days, we will drive as high as it is allowed. The crisp mountain air will have made you hungry! Close to the mountain you will sample a typical Japanese lunch, included in your program. After lunch, you’ll head for nearby Lake Yamanaka, an area famous for the healing powers of its hot spring waters. This is the perfect spot to get naked and feel the sensation of Japanese indoor and outdoor baths yourself. Now you are all refreshed it is time to get some serious shopping done! The Gotemba Premium Outlets are the largest outlet shopping venue in Japan. Included are discount coupons, and you can shop around for about 2 hours. There is a wide range of national and international brands available, with Mt Fuji ever-present in the background. At the end of the day, you will be dropped of at Shinjuku Station in Tokyo again. Itinerary: 08.50 am Meet your guide near Shinjuku station Bring your reservation confirmation sheet to show to the guide. 09.00 am Bus departs for Mt. Fuji (about 120 min) Visit Gotemba Mount Fuji 5th Station and spend around 30 minutes to admire the views. 12:40 - 13:40 Drive to Yoshida (60 min) and enjoy your Japanese-style lunch (included). 14:00 - 15:00 At Lake Yamanaka Onsen (60 min) where you enjoy a traditional soak in the hot spring waters. 15:40 - 17:40 Shop at the Gotemba Premium Outlets (120 min). the Gotemba Premium Outlets are the largest outlet shopping center in Japan. Enjoy shopping with Mt. Fuji in the background at this huge outlet mall. 19:10 - 19:40 Return at Shinjuku station. Your tour ends upon arrival near the West Exit of Shinjuku Station. This tour is available every Monday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. Not available during the winter season. ※Vegetarian meal Some animal products may be used as a soup stock for the vegetarian meal. Alcohol and mirin (sweet sake) can also be used for all types of meals. If you cannot eat these products, please choose the "without lunch" option.
strTitle: Visit Mt Fuji and Gotemba Premium Outlets in a day tour!

strIntroduction: Making Japanese pottery is an excellent way to experience Japanese culture. Pottery in Japan is the oldest form of art in the country. Yet due to its long history, many people believe making pottery requires special and sophisticated skills. But it’s not true! Anyone can make pottery! Even if you think your not good with your hands, the artisans who speak English will help you! Within the one hour, you can create as many creations as you can. The number of works is unlimited! Going through the process of trimming, glazing, and firing twice, your work will be done 3 weeks after your experience date. Please choose if you would like to pick up your work to our studio, or have them sent overseas. Price does not include calcination fee and shipping fee. Calcination fee depends on your work's size. We calculate by high X wide X diameter X 1.5, and price is about 1500 JPY for a rice bowl. Shipping is possible overseas. We use the Japanese international EMS posting service. For these additional payments required on the day, we accept Japanese Yen and the credit cards below: Visa, Master card, American Express, JCB, Discover When you make a booking, please choose if you prefer "wheel throwing" or "hand-building." Children over 3 are very welcome too! We believe that kids should not be limited in finding their potential.When they are open to new ideas and experiences, they can create ANYTHING in their lives! Kids will receive the basic information about material, firing and pottery making process. The class is for one hour and the cost is as the same as adults. Our studio is located just 5 minutes away from Tokyo Tower; come stop by on your visit to this area!
strTitle: Join a Japanese Pottery Class

strIntroduction: Experience making and cooking Udon, one of the most loved traditional noodle in Japan! Many foreign travelers come to us daily to learn how to make handmade Udon and experience cooking real Japanese food in our Udon program. A Short History of Udon: Once upon a time, Kobo Daishi (The Grand Master who propagated Buddhist teachings) visited a farmer's house and he found one sick farmer. There were no doctors around, and the farmer did not have any food in the house. In the corner of the earthen floor of the farmer's house, Kobo found some wheat in a pot. He then made something noodle-like from the wheat, emulating the methods used in China where they ground wheat with a stone and kneaded it with Aya River water until it turned into dough. Daishi tried to eat the noodles with chopsticks but he could not retrieve them from the pan. Hence, he sourced for cut branches from a willow tree and weaved bamboo, creating something like a ladle. Daishi offered this very first noodle, the very first Udon to be made, to the farmer. The father ate it and recovered from his illness soon after.
strTitle: Experience Handmade Udon Noodle Making

strIntroduction: Make a reservation for this full day Hiroshima and Miyajima tour departing from Central Hiroshima! Also enjoy the relaxing atmosphere of Hiroshima City and Miyajima while enjoying the beautiful view of the scenery! strIntroduction: The tour starts at Shin-Fuji Station or Fuji Station or Shizuoka Station. Meeting around 9:00 am to 10:00 am will be fine. A chartered taxi will take us to the destination below: 6-hour itinerary: ● Tea Farm The view of green tea fields against Mt. Fuji is magnificent to see! You can learn about tea processing from a local tea grower and enjoy a taste of their tea. ● Omiya yoko-cho, side street (Fried noodle street) Enjoy famous local food which won the 1st prize in a semi-gourmet nationwide contest for two years in a row. ● Fujisan Hongu Sengen Shrine This shrine has been the head shrine for more than 1,300 Sengen shrines throughout Japan. This Sengen shrine was first built to pacify the eruption of Mt. Fuji in 806. Many successive emperors and powerful samurais and shogun families have shown profound reverence toward the shrine in the past. ● Fuji Takasago Sake Brewery Founded in 1831, Fuji Takasago is situated where Mt. Fuji’s pure groundwater is abundant for use and an ideal location for superb sake making. You can enjoy sampling good Japanese sake. 8-hour itinerary: Includes all of the above plus Shiraito Falls. ● Shiraito Fall is one of the sites of the Fujisan World Heritage. The spring water from Mt. Fuji can be seen as a great view of the fall with the width of 100m and the height of 25m.
strTitle: Take a Trip to the Outskirts of Mt Fuji in Shizuoka

strIntroduction: Mr. Kanemitsu Katsuta is the leader of KOZIN, the institute of martial arts entertainment. KOZIN is on the cutting-edge of entertainment, games, sports, and martial arts. Use “Rai-may ψ” and your country will welcome you as the first SAMURAI of this age. The flow of the class: 1) Study the manners of Japanese traditional martial arts. 2) Practice playing X:Martial KOZIN-SWORD. 3) Battle Simulation game using 'Rai-may ψ' . Also... optional class (1 more hour) 1) Learn how to use a KATANA sword. 2) Learn how to wear a hakama. 3) Ni-ten-ichi-ryu school class (Noda-Ha) https://youtu.be/lMm8qWatzD0 Our aim is to revolutionize technology by combining/utilizing the spirit and techniques from all generations of Japan. In this innovative product, there is built-in non-destructive inspecting and wireless technology. Recently, as a result of our developments, KOZIN-MON exhibited an experimental model of “Rai-may ψ” for the Tokyo Game Show and Japan Expo in Russia. Our product 'Rai-may ψ' is a training tool for people interested in martial arts. We call this new type of martial arts, “X:Martial KOZIN”.
strTitle: Hone Your Samurai Skills with KOZIN: A Martial Arts Game

strIntroduction: A fantastic chance to discover some rural charm just a short train ride away from the metropolis of Kyoto City. Discover the wonderful nature and ancient religious sites in Kurama and Kibune. We meet in the city and take a train ride to Kibune village, a place well-known for its beautiful riverside and peaceful scenery. There is also an exquisite shrine called the "Kibune Shrine", where you can see an amazing view of red lanterns along an old stairway. Here we can drink fresh water flowing from the hills and say a prayer for good relationships. After a quick visit at the shrine we are on to the hiking course. It's a bit of a "stairmaster" to the top and requires a moderate level of fitness but the peak can be reached within 30-40mins. We will certainly take plenty of stops to enjoy the breathtaking nature along the way, as well as some features unique to this trail. After we reach the top of the mountain, we will be visiting Kurama Temple. This splendid temple will provide you with an amazing view of the valley below. Lets relax and enjoy the fresh air in the mountains. As we wander down the steps from the temple, we will make our way to the little town of Kurama to enjoy a nice lunch followed by a trip to an outdoor bath! The bath, also called an 'onsen' is full with rich minerals that will energise your body and soul. You will also witness the tranquil view of the countryside, surrounded by hills. In my opinion, this 'onsen' provides the best outdoor bathing experience in West Japan. After a nice, relaxing bath, it's time to hop on the train to get back to the city feeling refreshed and energised. Come take a breathtaking riverside stroll, a visit to one of Japan's most photographed shrines, a hike through nature, and a hot spring experience you will never forget! I look forward to exploring this gem in hills of Kyoto with you!
strTitle: Hike to Kurama Temple & Enjoy a Hot Spring Bath!

strIntroduction: This program offers one day tours that depart from Kanazawa to Shirakawago, Kanazawa to Shirakawago and Gokayama, and Kanazawa to Shirakawago and Takayama. The tour for Shirakawago and Takayama will take you to the UNESCO World Heritage Sites (Shirakawago village and Ainokura village), as well as to Fukumitsu town in Toyama where you will stroll the traditional shopping street Sasaraya and will try making your own senbei rice crackers. The tour for Takayama will include a visit to one of Japan's best preserved traditional old towns, and home to one of the country's three most famous festivals (Takayama Festival). The itinerary for the tour departing for Shirakawago and Gokayama is as follows: 08:00 Depart from the coach stop at Kanazawa Station Kanazawa Port Gate 11:15 or earlier (depends on the season) Free time at Shirakawago and Lunch 13:15-14:30 Free time at Ainokura village in Gokayama 15:15-15:45 Explore the shopping street Sasaraya in Fukumitsu town and make your own rice crackers 16:30 Arrive at Kanazawa Station Tour end This tour runs only on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays. The itinerary for the tour departing for Shirakawago and Takayama is as follows: 08:00 Depart from the coach stop at Kanazawa Station Kanazawa Port Gate 11:15 or earlier (depends on the season) Free time at Shirakawago and Lunch 13:00 or 13:45 (depends on the season) Free time at Takayama 16:15-16:45 Explore the shopping street Sasaraya in Fukumitsu town and make your own rice crackers 17:30 Arrive at Kanazawa Station Tour end This tour runs only on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays. The itinerary for the tour departing for Shirakawago only is as follows: 08:00 Depart from the coach stop at Kanazawa Station Kanazawa Port Gate 11:15 or earlier (depends on the season) Free time at Shirakawago and Lunch 16:15-16:45 Explore the shopping street Sasaraya in Fukumitsu town and make your own rice crackers 17:30 Arrive at Kanazawa Station Tour end This tour runs only on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays. ※Tour schedule is not fixed. Your host will announce if the tour will be held 5 days prior to the activity date.
strTitle: Book a One Day Trip to Shirakawago, Gokayama, or Takayama!

strIntroduction: [Season promotion] We would like our guests to enjoy the four seasons of Japan. Our Hot-air-balloon experience offers special views of each seasons from the sky. In each period listed below, we'd like to offer free accommodation and breakfast to the three first-come groups. October 3rd - 30th, 2016 (Season in flight) gives 150% longer flight than normal plans October 31st - November 27th, 2016 (Autumn flight) offers 150% longer flight and glasses of wine after flight November 28th - December 25th, 2016 (Christmas flight) is the most romantic flight in the year with Christmas decoration and drinks. January 2nd - 29th, 2017 (New year flight) will be great start of new year for you by seeing the sunrise from the sky. January 30th - February 27th, 2017 (Valentine's Day flight) makes your love luck the best by wishing upon the balloon. February 27th - April 2nd, 2017 (Spring flight) show the scene of cherry blossoms spreading. April 3rd - April 30th, 2017(New season flight) gives you and your precious person the best memories in the time for farewell. [Activity] With us you can have the opportunity to see Japan in an unique way from the sky enjoy it's natural landmarks and get to know the traditional Japanese lifestyle. The morning of the flight day, we will meet from 4:00 to 6:00 am depends on the season. If you can come by your own to the agreed meeting point, I will meet you there and we can go together to the flight site. If your group is under 3 people, I can pick you up at a hotel around Koga Station or the free guesthouse we arrange for the rest until early morning. Please let me know in advance. The day experience - standard plan: Before going to the flight site, we'll fly a pilot balloon to check the wind direction and speed and decide the launching site. This balloon is very important to determine the weather on the day and we'll watch it until it disappears in the sky. Arriving to the flight site, you can join the crew for unpacking and assembling the balloon. We will be airborne at around 7:00 to catch the sunrise depending on the season. We will be in the air for about 30-40 min (or 15-20 minutes per members in case of the standard plan). I'll take you to higher or lower levels so that you can enjoy the altitude as much as possible. The crew team will chase the balloon to its uncertain landing point. If landing on a public street, you can join the excitement of packing the balloon in a speedy way. After landing I will provide a cup of tea or coffee depending on the season, in the beautiful nature of the Watarase natural reserve. We'll head to the warehouse to store the balloon and say good-bye to the crew team. You can fly all year round. However, in the event of strong wind or rain, the flight will be cancelled. The maximum number of participants is 6 people. The minimum number of participants for the standard plan is 4 people. If you are a single traveler, please see the special plans below. Special plans: 1. Single traveler: Give yourself a special treat and a present with this hot air balloon flight! Maximum number of participants: 1 2. Couple plan: Enjoy the romantic scenery from above together! Maximum number of participants: 2 3. Family plan: Safeness gears and special straps included. Specially targeted for families with kids. Maximum number of participants: 3 4. Surprise plan: Before arriving and assembling the balloon, we will give an eyemask and earplugs to your partner. When everything is ready, the surprise will be awesome! Maximum number of participants: 3 Note: If the total weight of all passengers is under 200 kg, it is possible to fit 4 people in the family and surprise plans. Free for children under 12-year-old.
strTitle: See the Sunrise from a Hot Air Balloon just outside Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Guide: Shuri Misono (味園 朱利) Join me on this Izakaya Pub Crawl tour! I know fantastic pub locations in Japan for drinking such as hidden taverns that only locals know about, as well as popular tourist attractions. Izakaya is the term for a Japanese-style pub where people go after work for casual drinking. The main pub I will introduce you to is the Chain Store, as it is traveller-friendly, although not many travellers know about this place. Another nice restaurant that I will bring you to is Self-Employment. This establishment has been around for decades, however even many young local Japanese do not know of this shop as they have not dared to explore these hidden places. I can also guide you through famous tourists places in Tokyo if you want, such as Akihabara, where you can feel the pulse of anime dance music on the streets and enjoy watching cartoons such as Moe Moe Kyun Maid Cafe. Join me on this flexible and fun tour! Asakusa, Ueno, Shinbashi, Akihabara, Shinjuku Omoide Yokocho (a side street), Izakaya street, and Ueno bar in Ameyoko. Availability: Weekends, public holidays, and weekday nights. Please contact me in advance. It's very short for 1.5 hours. I can't do anymore than introduce 1 pub. I recommend 2 hours. If there are many 1 participants, I do jointly. This is an rare case. If you wish for a private tour only of 1 person, please contact me beforehand. Photo by https://flic.kr/p/eXkXLC
strTitle: Join hidden Izakaya＆Sake Pub Crawl Tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this tour you will visit the famous Otaku places in Japan in 5 to 6 hours. I will pick you up at your hotel and will take you to the famous Otaku places in Tokyo. The tour will start at 10:00. First, we will go to Nakano, which is located west of Shinjuku. You will see many interesting second-hand goods (Japanese and foreign). Of course, you'll be able to buy new items too. Once we're done with the shopping in Nakano, we can have lunch or head straight to Akihabara. When we go to Akihabara, we will try to visit as many shops as you want. Of course, I will do the all translation for you, so you don`t have to worry about getting lost or anything. If you like, I will take to a maid cafe (I am not their biggest fan, but I will take you there anyway). At the end of the tour, we can finish in Akihabara, or I can take you back to your hotel. Enjoy one day shopping around Tokyo's most famous Otaku locations!
strTitle: Join an Otaku Shopping Tour!

strIntroduction: In this tour we will got to Fushimi area in south Kyoto to explore the origins of the local sake production! I will pick you up at Kyoto Station or at your hotel. You can choose how to go to Fushimi, by train or taxi. Train is the easiest and cheapest way, and it takes about 30 minutes to the destination. The ticket costs 260 JPY per person. If you would like to take a taxi, it costs about 3000 JPY. I am a licensed tour guide and an experienced traveler, so I will take you to Fushimi safely and entertain you. I'll introduce you to the culture of Japanese sake and you can take a look at the old tool of sake production. We will go to Gekkeikan Okura Kinenkan (a local sake museum). There you will see big barrels, steamers, containers, funnels, flasks, tanks and other items related to sake production. After seeing the museum you can taste three kinds of sake for free. And you can also buy your favorite sake. Nearby is the famous historical building, the Teradaya inn which dates back to the Meiji period. In addition, I will take you to Fushimi Inari Shrine as well! As an option, I can guide you through the historical heritage of Byodoin Temple too (please book the add-on option). Enjoy the trip with me and have great memory from your trip to Japan!
strTitle: 20% OFF Take a sake tour in Fushimi

strIntroduction: Tama river rafting is an exciting tour that all ages (6+) can have fun on throughout the season. Our tour is packed full of fun from start to the finish. When we are going down the river, we will stop for fun activities along the way, so you can fully enjoy your time on the river! We care about giving everyone a 100% fun tour all the time, so you will love the river as much as we do. Come enjoy Tama river rafting with us! If you planning to come by train, come to Oume station (JR Chuou line), and we will pick you up from the station. It will take about 1 hour and 30 minutes from JR Shinjuku station by train. The tour time is about 3 hours which includes getting ready, transport to the river, rafting, and chill-out time whilst checking out the photos from the tour. We are open everyday throughout the season. (4/19 - 10/25) Please contact us if you have any questions.
strTitle: River Rafting in Tama River

strIntroduction: This is a 4-hour bus tour, which you can watch Maiko show at Gion, enjoy delicious Kyoto cuisine, and even see the beautiful night view at the summit of Higashiyama! First of all, you can watch the Maiko show at Gion, which is one of the most traditional districts in Japan. Maikos are traditional performers who sing, dance, and play Japanese traditional instruments such as koto or shamisen for visitors. The way they dance is very fascinating and you may only experience this in Kyoto! Kyoto cuisine, which is also known as ""Kyo-ryori"", is the generic term of traditional Japanese cuisine made in Kyoto that includes Daikyo-ryori (grand banquet), Shojin-ryori (vegetarian dishes), Honzen-ryori (a high-grade Japanese meal served at once), Kaiseki (tea ceremony dishes), and Obanzai (side dishes featuring seasonal ingredients). With its sensitive tasting broth and beautiful appearance, eating Kyoto cuisine is one of the most popular activities in Japan. Higashiyama summit park is designated as a historical climate preservation district and you can see the night view from there on this tour. Needless to say, it is well-known as one of the best night views in Kyoto! If you join this tour, you can enjoy delicious Kyoto cuisine, watch a Maiko show and also see the beautiful night view. Don't miss this opportunity to fully enjoy Kyoto's traditional culture! This tour starts at 5pm at Kyoto station Karasumaru exit. You will receive multi-lingual audio guide during the experience. This tour is available everyday until September 30th, 2016. Notice: This tour will not be operated on April 2nd, 3rd, July 15th, 16th, 17th, 24th, August 16th)
strTitle: Enjoy Maiko Show & Kyoto Cuisine in Gion, Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Even if you haven't tried canoeing before, you can enjoy this tour which uses a Canadian canoe that is easy to balance and use. Glide effortlessly around the vast Lake Onuma with your guide leading you to areas with the best view and seasonal flowers in bloom on the lake. The 2hr session can fit easily into your packed schedule and provide a great memory for your family and friends! Don't miss this wonderful summer activity!
strTitle: 2hr Onuma Marsh Canoe Tour+Teatime! Beginners OK!

strIntroduction: Do you like to read Manga?? I guess a lot of people will say ''yes!'' ,as Japanese Manga are widely spread all over the world. But most of them have never tried to draw Manga even though they like it. Why don't you try drawing Japanese Manga as your experience or even hobby?? This Manga School , set in the pop culture center of Nakano, prepared the ''How to Draw Manga Course - English''. They are offering short programs that you can learn drawing Manga. Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/gju8qJ http://flic.kr/p/gjtF55 http://flic.kr/p/gjuUHe
strTitle: Learn How to Draw Japanese Manga

strIntroduction: Mt. Fuji is Japan's highest mountain and it's not surprising that the nearly perfectly shaped volcano has been worshiped as a sacred mountain and has experienced a big popularity among artists and general society throughout the centuries. Lake Ashi was formed in the caldera of Mt. Hakone after the volcano's last eruption 3,000 years ago. Today, the lake, with Mt. Fuji in the background, is the symbol of Hakone. The lake's shores are mostly undeveloped except for small towns in the east and north and a couple of lakeside resort hotels. The best views of the lake in combination with Mt. Fuji can be enjoyed from the sightseeing boat cruising the lake. The 1-day bus tour includes strolling around Odawara Castle Park, an all-you-can-eat crab lunch, cruising on the Hakone Pirate Ship, and strolling around Mt. Fuji New 5th Station. You'll start in Shinjuku in the morning and come back to Shinjuku in the evening. Tours with less than 15 participants will be cancelled. If this is the case, those who have made a reservation will be informed of the cancellation by 4 days prior to the scheduled departure date. Schedule details: Period: April 30 – September 27 Meeting place: Hotel Gracery Shinjuku Meeting time: 8:10 Return to Shinjuku: 18:30 – 19:00
strTitle: Enjoy a Hakone Cruise and Strolling Around Mt. Fuji!

strIntroduction: This is a full day bus tour departing from Naha. Not only can you enjoy a beautiful ocean view of Okinawa but you will experience ancient Okinawa by visiting the heritage site Nakijin Castle. The Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium is a part of the Ocean Expo Park located in Motobu, Okinawa. It is made up of four floors with tanks containing deep sea creatures, sharks, coral and tropical fish. Nakijin Castle was built in the 14th century and is in ruins now but also has something worth visiting and is the place in Japan where the first cherry blossoms bloom each year between mid-January and early February. Option 1: Adult (Age 11 and over) Option 2: Child (Age 6-11) Here are the details: 1. Check in Check in at the Naha Bus Temporary Office at 08:10. Pick up service is available. Okinawa Miyako Hotel (08:45) Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle (08:50) 2. Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium Visiting for 3 hours. 3. Nakijin Castle Visiting for 50 minutes. 4. Warumi Ohashi Bridge We will not stop here. You can look outside the window and take pictures of the scenery. 5.Kouri Island Visiting for 50 minutes. 6. Drop off (1) Drop off at Miyako Hotel Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle 7. Drop off (2) Drop off at the Naha Bus Terminal. Attentions: 1. Only a Japanese guide is available. 2. It could be delayed depending on the traffic conditions. Please spare at least 2 hours for your train or plane. 3. It could be canceled depending on the weather. 4. There are no seats for children under 6. If you want to book a seat for your child please book ages 6-11. 5. Please arrive at the bus station at least 20 minutes in advance to check in. 6. Lunch is not included.
strTitle: Tour an Aquarium, Kouri Island and Nakijin Castle, Okinawa

strIntroduction: Go to Tottori's famous desert near the sea and fly over the massive sand dunes which stretch for nearly 16 kilometers along the coastline! Choose between morning or afternoon paragliding course and soar in the sky! The panorama view over the dunes is fascinating! This activity is suitable for healthy people with no experience (even children older than 3 years old). A professional instructor will explain how to enjoy paragliding and how to use the rental equipment properly. Then you will try flying yourself in the sky. The view of the Sea of Japan and the vast desert will leave a lasting impression from your trip! Please note that the activity might be cancelled in case of bad weather. In summer it gets very hot at the sand dunes, so please prepare lots of water for drinking. Sunscreen and a hat are recommended. The half-day course begins at the following times and takes about 3 hours in total (with preparation and instructions): - 6:30 am - 9:30 am - 12:30 am - 15:30 am Enjoy the sky flight over Tottori's Sand Dunes!
strTitle: Paraglide over the sand dunes of Tottori's desert!

strIntroduction: Ishigaki island is located to the west of the main island of Okinawa and is a treasure trove of colorful coral reefs and tropical fishes. Snorkeling and diving is the best way to immerse yourself in this aquatic wonderland. You might even have a chance to see the Manta rays during the season! Take this opportunity to go snorkeling in one of Japan's most beautiful ocean to see colorful, lively fishes and coral reefs that sparkle when the sunlight shines through. Here is the basic daily schedule of the tour we have planned for you. 8:30AM Meet up at the dive shop. 9:00AM Depart to the snorkeling spot by boat. -1st Point: Coral reef (Half day course will go back to the shop 11:30) -2nd Point: Manta ray point 13:00PM Go back to the dive shop. -Lunch time. 15:00PM Go back to hotel. *Transportation service is available for the one day course. (Reservation required) *The half day course will not be going to the Manta point. Please join the one day course if you wish to see Manta rays.
strTitle: Go Snorkeling with Emerald Ocean! - in Ishigaki Island
