strIntroduction: Here is a list of places that I will take you to in Tokyo: - Asakusa. You can walk and eat at Nakamise street which looks like old Edo Tokyo. If you want you can pull a good luck charm called Omikuji at Sensoji Temple. This is the best spot if you like the image of old Japan. - Ueno Park. It's a cultural mecca with a number of museums including the prestigious Tokyo National Museum and the delightful Shitamachi Museum with its display of old Tokyo, Ueno Zoo and many galleries. We goes to SHINOBASULAKE and around park. - Shibuya. Here is the most famous scramble intersection. You can visit many attractive shops. - Shinjuku. You can shop at the biggest and cheapest shopping center called Don Quixote. - Izakaya"WATAMI" (bring cash with you). This is a Japanese bar called Izakaya. You can spend a great night here. We promise you reasonable prices. Izakaya is a Japanese-style pub popular among working people, which offers a variety of foods.
strTitle: Tour all the popular places in Tokyo with a local!

strIntroduction: This is a 8-hour tour around the most famous locations of Kyoto, Japan's ancient capital. Discover all the best treasures of the glorious city of emperors and traditions together with a very experienced and friendly guide. Following the pick-up at your hotel, we will go directly to the Kinkakuji Temple (the Golden Pavilion). The beautiful garden complex is one of the best in Japan. It's an excellent example of medieval Japanese garden design. The harmonious relationship between architecture and landscape were greatly emphasized and celebrated during that period, and you will still see this today in the beautiful reflection of the Golden Pavilion in the pond's still water surface. Next, we will visit Kiyomizu Temple. The original temple was founded in 798. Since Kiyomizu Temple's terrace stands 13 meters high, you can get a full panorama view of Kyoto city from here. Moreover, Kiyomizu means "pure water" in Japanese. It is said that water from the temple's spring can purify your soul and make your wishes come true. Stroll along the souvenir shops of the famous scenic Sannenzaka Hill, where you can have a traditional Japanese lunch. After lunch, we will go to Fushimi Inari Shrine. At this shrine, you will first see a pair of stone foxes. Because the tail of a fox resembles the ears of the rice plant, the fox was believed to be the messenger of the gods. Moreover, this shrine was worshiped as the patron of business by many merchants and manufacturers. There are roughly 10,000 "torii" or sacred shrine gates. Each of them is donated by believers. You will also walk at Nishiki Market. This market was founded about 1,300 years ago and is still well-known as "Kitchen of Kyoto". Moreover, you can eat around. This tour will be your most memorable experience of traditional Japan!
strTitle: Discover the most memorable treasures of Kyoto

strIntroduction: Enjoy your day by cycling around Tokyo with an English-speaking tour guide departing from Toranomon Hills! Explore some areas of Tokyo by choosing either one of the two available courses: 1. Traditional Tokyo Ride a bicycle from Toranomon Hills and explore Tokyo's traditional districts such as Hibiya Park, the Imperial Palace, Tsukiji Market, Ginza and Nihonbashi! 2. Bay Area cycle and cruise tour Ride a bicycle from Toranomon Hills and explore Tokyo's Bay Area all the way to Odaiba from where we'll return by a boat! Both programs start from Toranomon Hills, which is 5 minutes walking from Toranomon Station. The Traditional Tokyo tour starts at 9:00 am, while the Bay Area tour starts at 15:30 pm. The fee includes rent fee for the bicycle and lunch. Our guide will be waiting for you at the lobby in front of the Family Mart Convenience Store on the 3rd floor of the building. This tour is only available upon reservation, so we recommend you to use our reservation service to reserve this tour!
strTitle: Enjoy One Day Cycling Tour From Toranomon Hills in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Special offer only for Voyagin guests! We offer this tour at the cheapest price of any other suppliers. Don't miss this chance to enjoy one day bus tour exploring most of the best tourist spots in Tokyo in a day at a valuable price! Halal food lunch is also available! We also offer free pick up service from following area. Be sure to reach at least 5 minutes prior to departure time. Area 1 : Tokyo station, Ginza, Hibiya, Shinbashi, Shiodome Depart at 07:25am / Imperial Hotel Tokyo Area 2: Akasaka, Roppongi Depart at 07:35am / ANA Intercontinental hotel Akasaka Area 3: Chiyoda ward Depart at 07:50am / Hotel New Otani If you are looking for an adventurous sightseeing bus tour, here it is! This bus tour covers famous sightseeing spots in Tokyo. Enjoy the traditional Japanese garden at the Imperial Palace for the start of your tour, it will take your breath away and you’ll enjoy a peaceful and carefree feeling while you are there. The Sensoji temple and Kaminari-mon gate in Asakusa are a must-see, the magnificent structure of the temple is overwhelming. You will also be able to experience the enthusiastic atmosphere of Tsukiji Fish Market on this bus tour. Although the Tokyo Bay Cruise is only 20-minutes long, its full of excitement, and the view from under the Rainbow bridge will be unforgettable. After the cruise, it's shopping time! Prepare a shopping list, so you won’t miss out on what you want. While you are on the bus, the excitement will be continuous. The bus will pass by the National Diet, Ameyoko open-air market, Tokyo Skytree, Kabuki-za Theater and much more. It's absolutely amazing to visit all those sightseeing spots in one day!! --Brief itinerary-- 8:30 Depart from the meeting point at Shinjuku (The meeting point is Shinjuku Island Tower at 8:20) 9:00-9:40 Imperial Palace East Garden Relax and feel the breeze in the greenery. 10:15-11:15 Sensoji Temple, Asakusa Explore one of the most famous temples in Japan! 12:00-12:45 Tsukiji Fish Market Enjoy world famous fish market in the tour. 13:15-14:40 Aqua City Odaiba Enjoy shopping, not to forget this fantastic memory of the tour! Have lunch and choose between a buffet style meal or a Halal lunch! 14:45-15:05 Tokyo Bay Cruise See the fascinating view of Tokyo Bay! You have choices where to get off the bus. Choices are from Ginza, Shinbashi, Tokyo Tower, Shibuya, and Harajuku. 16:00 The final stop is Shinjuku Station south exit. --Notices-- ・The tour is operated daily from February 15, 2016 to December 31, 2016 (Except Feb 28). ・The minimum participant to run the tour is 1. ・A tour assistant in English and Japanese is available. ・A multilingual audio guidance in English, Spanish, Chinese and Thai is available. ・Itinerary order is subject to change depending on traffic and weather. ・The weather and traffic condition on the day may change the time and order of itinerary. ・If a sightseeing spot is closed, we will replace it with an alternative place. ・If you prefer Halal Lunch, the booking must be made 3 days in advance. The tour is free for children 5 years and below.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Bus Tour Around Best Tourist Spots in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: At the very core of Japanese people's philosophy lies Shintoism, a belief that gods exist and can be found in all natural materials in this world (mountains, rivers, lightning, wind, waves, trees, rocks). We want to bring you into the centre of this pristine nature in Keihoku to enjoy the spectacular scenery and appreciate the harmonious relationship between humans and nature. In this tour, we visit a waterfall deep in the forest, as well as spend time in the tranquil Joshokoji temple. We will also bring you to a beautiful village called Miyama where you can see thatched houses and catch a beautiful panoramic view of Kyoto. Itinerary 9:30 You will take a bus from Kyoto station to Shuzan '周山' by yourself 11:00 Host will pick you up at Shuzan 11:00-17:30 we will tour the sightseeing spots in Shuzan (Joshokuji Temple, Miyama and others) 17:40 You will take a bus from Shuzan to Kyoto station by yourself 19:00 Back to Kyoto station
strTitle: Trek in Nature's Beauty & Visit a Peaceful Temple Garden

strIntroduction: Tokyo is a megalopolis and does not really have a 'center'. Each district or ward is in some way or form specialized in terms of the things you can do and the goods you can buy. For a newcomer, it can be quite an overwhelming experience trying to meander through the city to find that 'one store' that sells that 'one thing' you are looking for. If you do not speak Japanese, it can be quite a challenge. This customized shopping tour of Tokyo will enable you to savour the distinct flavours of the city, while having the opportunity to shop till you drop - Every category and preference will be catered for, from food to souvenirs to high-end branded goods. As a local shopping expert, we know where to take you to find the best deals for whatever you are looking for. We are very flexible and will flow according to the mood of the moment! Some of the areas we may visit are as follows. Please select 1 or 2 places from the listed ones. ※Please note that if you wish to visit more than 2 areas, additional fees may apply. Ginza Akihabara Ueno Ikebukuro Shinjuku Harajuku Shibuya Nippori Daikanyama Omotesando
strTitle: Half Day Shopping Tour of Tokyo

strIntroduction: One of the best things about this tour is that it is VERY FLEXIBLE as it will be designed specifically for your needs. Upon confirming your booking, I will send an email with some suggested itineraries as well as a list of my own personal highlights and favourites. Browse through at your leisure and email me a few days before your tour with any requests you have. One idea of a common 1 day itinerary: HEIAN JINGU: Here we will stroll the classic Chinese style garden and talk about the early days of life in the court filled with poetry and the smell of incense and get a taste of life in the ancient capital which was originally named Heian “capital of peace and tranquillity” GINKAKUJI TEMPLE: Ginkakuji or the Silver Pavilion was built by a shogun who reigned during the birth of Higashiyama culture, a time when the tea ceremony and the philosophy of “wabi-sabi” or beauty in imperfection was born. Before death this shogun became a Zen priest and his villa was turned into a Zen temple. NANZEN-Ji: A beautiful temple complex with an amazing rock garden, Nanzen-Ji is one of the important Zen temples in Kyoto complete with a famous rock garden. It also has an expansive ground with plenty of sub-temples and gardens surrounding the area. A great place to soak up the atmosphere without all the crowds. GION: This ancient entertainment district has a fantastic atmosphere and was a symbol of the rise of the merchant class in the 17th century. Just before dinner you will sometimes see "geisha" and "maiko" running off to a dinner appointment in their wooden slippers. A few hours later you will see the modern equivalent hostesses clipping along on high heels to classy lounge bars to entertain the well-to-do. An interesting glimpse into the form of night entertainment traditionally referred to as the water trade or "mizu shobai". We can use a variety of transport including taxis depending on what is the most convenient but not to worry as your guide will whisk you from place to place. The busy season is upon us so make sure to enquire now if you are interested and I can hold the date for you. Looking forward to showing you around this splendid city.
strTitle: Kyoto Fun: Personalised Private Tour

strIntroduction: Go on an evening walk through Shinjuku, which is Tokyo’s famous entertainment district, and get a local's look into the best shopping and night life. Discover the Omoide Yokocho, an alley lined with small restaurants serving delicious street food, the notorious red-light district of Kabukicho and more! The standard plan is as follows: 17:30 Meet up at Shinjuku Station East Exit From Shinjuku Station East Exit to Shopping Area Isetan & Marui One Shinjuku Suehirotei Theater (pass-by) Hanazono Shrine (15 min) Goldengai District Kabukicho Area (30 min) Ichibangai, Chuo-dori, Don Quijote, Game Arcade Omoide Yokocho 20:30 End of tour Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/yZcrv -https://flic.kr/p/zLbAQ -https://flic.kr/p/5L1xVN -https://flic.kr/p/7Xfyrz -https://flic.kr/p/2bChNc
strTitle: Night Walking Tour around Shinjuku and Kabuki-cho!

strIntroduction: In this 3-hour tour we show our guests the delicious side of Shibuya which is a place more known for being at the forefront of culture and fashion, and rarely known for its food. Starting in Shibuya Station we give our guests a chance to take a few pictures such of the surrounding area as the popular Hachiko Statue, the Scramble crossing and the busy shopping streets before moving along to our first stop , an Okonomiyaki Restaurant . Here you will be able to sit up close and personal with the cooks as they make the most delicious Hiroshima Okonomiyaki. Delicious with every bite you can have vegetarian, seafood or meat stuffed versions all big enough to satisfy the most intense hunger After we are done, we head out through the heart of the action giving guests a chance to see the seemingly endless ocean of neon lights. We head up through the central shotengai (shopping street) weaving in and out of alleys and streets to give our guests a chance to see the hustle and bustle of the area. We will also take you to the Karaoke where a scene from Lost in Translation was shot. We will go to another restaurant that specializes in some of the most authentic flavors of the South of Japan. Here we will sample 3 or more local dishes that are very scrumptious and authentic, some flavors that you will never ever forget. Once this is done, we will visit Depachika , also known as food wonderland where you can see some very traditional and authentic Japanese desserts, snacks and other food. After we finish we will head back to the glitz and glam for some dessert and then to the crossing to get a few shots when the lights are brightest before saying good night. Tour starts from 5PM up to 7:30PM.
strTitle: Go out on a Shibuya Evening Walking Food Tour!

strIntroduction: This hassle-free tour is designed to give you a chance to visit and see Osaka's top attractions and includes a day-trip to Kyoto as well. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1: Pick-up from Kansai International Airport Transfer to Hotel (must be within Osaka City Center) Day 2: Osaka Private Walking Tour 10:00 Pick-up from hotel (must be within Osaka City Center) Visit the following places: - Osaka Castle - Dotombori - Shinsaibashi - Kuchu Teien 15:00 Tour ends, return to hotel or continue sightseeing Day 3: Nara Day Trip 09:00 Meet Guide at Osaka Station or Namba Station Proceed to Nara by train Start of Nara Walking Tour Places to Visit - Todaiji, home of the Great Buddha - Kasuga Taisha Grand Shrine - Nara Park - Old Town of Nara Return to Nara by train 17:00 End of Tour Day 4: Kyoto Day Tour 09:00 Meet at Osaka Station Proceed to Kyoto by train Start of Kyoto walking tour Places to visit: - Kiyomizudera - Higashiyama old street - Yasaka Jinja - Heian Shrine - Fushimi Inari Return to Osaka by train 17:00 End of tour Day 5: Pick-up at Hotel (must be within Osaka City Center) Transfer to Kansai International Airport What this tour includes: - round-trip private airport transfers - Studio passes to Universal Studios Japan - English-speaking guide for the tours - round-trip tickets to Kyoto via rapid train - entrance fees to attractions included in the tour *This tour package is not available on the following dates: April 29 to May 5, 2016; and August 11 to 16, 2016 *Itinerary may change due to local conditions
strTitle: Enjoy Osaka: a 5-day package tour (minimum 5 adults)

strIntroduction: The shamisen is a traditional 3-string Japanese instrument similar to a banjo and traditionally used to accompany Japanese Minyou, or folk music. There are, however, varying styles of playing the shamisen, including the up-tempo and percussive Tsugaru style of the Tsugaru region in Northern Japan. In recent years, Tsugaru Shamisen has become popularized by the soulful and bombastic style of the Yoshida Brothers, whose playing have turned the folk instrument into a stage performance. Although it may seem daunting to learn, anyone can learn to play simple songs like the popular Japanese folksong "Sakura Sakura" or even up-tempo pieces on the shamisen quickly.
strTitle: Learn to Play the Shamisen and Koto

strIntroduction: Tokyo has a lot of attractive spots to look around so it's not easy to make a priority where to visit first and to plan put routes. That's why this half day sightseeing tour that takes you to the best places of Tokyo is a great option for any traveler. Starting from the morning with a pick-up from designated Hotels then visiting popular spots with an English guide. The first stop is Tokyo Tower the long-time famous symbol of the city. The tower has 2 different observation decks that show off different scenery an its magnificent panoramic view is really worth seeing. There are also lots of exciting things there such as looking down from the transparent wide window on the deck, going to the top of 600 steps, visiting a power spot of the towering shrine, many of these have long queues, so visiting them in the morning is the wise plan and is a highlight of this tour. After that, the tour visits Meiji Shrine which is well known as one of Japan's most popular shrines and has a forest of approximately 100,000 trees that were donated from regions across the entire country for the goal of making a natural forest within Tokyo's busy city. Among the trees there is a wide range of nature including animals such as racoons, halcyon, and others that are rare to see in the middle of the city. The main shrine building stands in quiet solemnity and such sights are gaining in popularity especially among young ladies. After the tranquil forest the tour moves to the Imperial Palace where you can see Akasaka State Guest House that is a remaining example of a Meiji-era structure in the baroque architectural style famous for being designated as a National Treasure of Japan. Then, the National Diet Building, which is an impressive building. At the Imperial Palace East Garden, there are the remains of the former castle tower and a beautiful and elegant Japanese garden where you can enjoy its peaceful, serene beauty. After the Imperial Palace, the tour will end at Ginza where both the latest fashion trends and old traditions can be seen and is famous for its high brand shops from all over the world. The one-day tour schedule is as follows: 07:30- 09:00 Pick up at designated Hotels 08:45 Ana Intercontinental Tokyo 08:30 Celestine Hotel 08:55 Conrad Tokyo 08:55 Courtyard Marriott Ginza Tobu Hotel Tokyo Tower (30 minutes) Meiji Shrine (40 minutes) Akasaka Guest House (Drive by) National Diet Building (Drive by) Imperial Palace East Garden (40 minutes) Ginza Shopping District (Drive Through) 13:00 Tour ends in Ginza ※Please choose pickup points from the following list: 08:45 Ana Intercontinental Tokyo 08:30 Celestine Hotel 08:55 Conrad Tokyo 08:55 Courtyard Marriott Ginza Tobu Hotel 09:00 Daiichi Hotel Annex 09:00 Daiichi Hotel Tokyo 08:50 Excel Hotel Tokyu Akasaka 08:35 Grand Hyatt Tokyo 08:05 Grand Prince Hotel New Takanawa 08:10 Hilton Tokyo 08:10 Hotel Grand Palace 07:40 Hotel Metropolitan (Ikebukuro) 08:45 Hotel New Otani 08:45 Hotel Okura Tokyo 08:15 Hyatt Regency Tokyo 08:55 Imperial Hotel Tokyo 08:40 Intercontinental Tokyo Bay 08:20 Keio Plaza Hotel Tokyo 08:40 Mandarin Oriental Tokyo 08:40 Marunouchi Hotel 08:50 Mercure Hotel Ginza Tokyo 08:00 Odakyu Hotel Century Southern Tower 08:45 Palace Hotel Tokyo 08:55 Park Hotel Tokyo 08:30 Park Hyatt Tokyo 08:30 Royal Park (Near Tokyo City Air Terminal 08:55 Royal Park Shiodome Tower 08:15 Sheraton Miyako Hotel Tokyo 08:50 Shiba Park Hotel 08:00 Shinagawa Prince Hotel 08:00 Shinjuku Prince Hotel 08:25 Shinjuku Washington Hotel 07:30 Sunshine City Prince Hotel 08:50 The Capitol Hotel Tokyu 08:25 The New Sanno Hotel 08:40 The Prince Park Tower Tokyo 08:40 The Rits Carlton Tokyo 08:00 Tokyo Dome Hotel 08:45 Tokyo Prince Hotel
strTitle: Enjoy Half-Day Tour of Best Tokyo Spots with English Guide!

strIntroduction: If you are a traditional Japanese art enthusiast, you should definitely join this program to learn Kyoto's traditional textile dyeing method at a studio located in Kyoto. The dyeing method that you will be learning with this program is the "Roketsu" dyeing method, one of the oldest and the most traditional dyeing methods in Japan. "Roketsu" is also known as wax-resist dyeing, because the wax blocks the dyeing ink and leaves the covered area white. The traditional "Roketsu" method needs over 20 steps to complete. In "Roketsu" method, the thickness and the shades of the patterns are different, so the patterns have three-dimensional impression. The temperature of the brush used in "Roketsu" method is approximately around 150℃. You can try the "Roketsu" dyeing method and make a square dyed cloth, luncheon mat, tapestry, Japanese towel, or T-shirt. This program is available everyday except on Wednesday from 10:00-18:00. Reservation is difficult to make, so use our service to book this program with no hassles!
strTitle: Learn Kyoto's Textile Dyeing Method at a Studio in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Kyoto has a large cultural legacy coming from its 1200 year-long history and offers an incredible number of attractions for tourists. Among them, this private walking tour is planned to discover Kyoto's hidden beauty and explore the heart of Kyoto. The guide will take you not only to major tourists' spots but also to lesser-known alleys and markets. At the end of the tour, you will agree that the best feature of Kyoto city is the mixture of the new and the old! ☆Tour Course☆ The tour starts from Kyoto station. (If you book a hotel pickup option,the tour starts from lobby of your hotel. The picking applicable hotels are limited to the hotels between Higashi-oji-dori and Nishi-oji-dori (to the east and west) and Imadegawa-dori and Jujo-dori(to the north and south. If you need a taxi or a hired car, an additional fee will be charged.) ↓ Sanjusangen-do ↓ Kiyomizu Temple ↓ Sannenzaka ↓ Gion ↓ End of tour (Tour guide will assist you how to get to the subway station or the nearby bus stop for your next visiting spot or your hotel) ☆Tour Highlight☆ "Don't jump off the cliff" / Kiyomizu Temple This temple predates the foundation of Kyoto and has had millions of pilgrims ever since. It is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site with over 30 structures, including a huge wooden veranda in front of the main hall that juts out over the cliff and provides you a panoramic view of Kyoto. There is a famous expression: that states "You must jump off the stage of Kiyomizu." It means that you should take the plunge to make your dreams come true. "Most walked street in Kyoto" / Sannenzaka This sloped path leading to Kiyomizu temple was originally paved with stones in about 808 AD and may be the most walked street in Kyoto. It is lined with old wooden houses running restaurants and shops selling pottery, artworks and other traditional goods. You may come across young women dressed in kimono and feel as though you had traveled back in time to the days of 300 years ago. "Encounter Geiko and Maiko" / Gion Gion is the entertainment district beautifully lined with traditional town houses and restaurants, you will encounter geiko and maiko, professional entertainers trained in traditional Japanese dance and music, including the playing the shamisen (like a three-stringed guitar) and singing. They can be seen wearing, beautiful, elaborate kimonos as they walk to and from appointments.
strTitle: Exploring the Heart of Kyoto (Half Day)

strIntroduction: Hozugawa River's rapid streams run between the mountain slopes of Arashiyama and Sagano. The river cruise starts near Kameoka Station and continues for about 16 exciting kilometers down the stream to Arashiyama, just in front of the famous Togetsukyo Bridge. During the time when Kyoto was Japan's capital, the boats used to transport logs and timber for the construction of temples and other buildings in the developing city. Although this practice was discontinued with the invention of railway transportation, the Hozugawa River cruise remains a popular tourist attractions for visitors of Kyoto. In this activity you will embark on a joyful and thrilling boat ride down the rapid swirls of the river. Along the way you will have plenty of opportunities to enjoy the stunning natural beauty of the ravine and discover interesting odd-shaped rocks near the river bed. The entire cruise is about 1.5-2 hours long. Boatmen equipped with oars and bamboo poles navigate the traditional-style wooden boat and show the most attractive natural formations along the way. This ride is available for booking throughout the entire year. You can choose the starting time from the following: - 9:00 - 10:00 - 11:00 - 12:00 - 13:00 - 14:00 - 15:30 Please indicate the starting time when you make a booking. Please kindly book at least 2 days in advance as it takes a day for us to process your booking.
strTitle: Ride a boat down the scenic Hozugawa River, Kyoto

strIntroduction: We love Kyoto and we love the world of the Geisha. It is our pleasure to provide impressive and fun experience to the people through traditional Kyoto culture. At our studio you can transform into a Geisha, complete with real traditional wigs, kimonos, obis, shoes and accessories. And then you can have a studio portrait made, take your own photos and walk around on the great old streets that are just minutes from our front door. Our staffs extend a warm welcome to you. Let us turn you into a Japanese Geisha. Many foreign guests have visited us. We are an internationally experienced team! We are located Kyoto's legendary Gion district, the most famous home of the Geisha in all of Japan. This area is loaded with old places and things to do: restaurants, ryokan inns, tea houses and other settings. Our studio is full of classic Japanese atmosphere. The studio is in a traditional machiya townhouse. We even have a tsuboniwa interior garden, where you can take pictures of yourself as a Geisha (it is the only place in Kyoto that offers this special background setting). Come and enjoy our maiko experience in traditional 100-year-old machiya townhouse! *Please note that if you make a booking with a walking plan or the plans that contains outdoor activities, it might be changed to the basic plan in case of rain.(You will get a refund for the price difference.)
strTitle: 15% OFF Maiko Makeover in Kyoto Gion

strIntroduction: Explore the best Kyoto has to offer with this historical full day tour of Japan's ancient capital departing from Umeda or Namba in Osaka. This tour will take you by bus to Kyoto, where you will first make a stop at one of Japan's most iconic Shino shrines, the Fushimi Inari Shrine, famous for its countless bright-colored torii gates lining the pathway up a mountain. You'll have plenty of time to explore and take amazing pictures. The tour will then move on to Arashiyama area in western Kyoto using local trains. You'll be able to visit the world-famous bamboo forest and admire the traditional architecture of the area. It's the perfect spot to enjoy a traditional Japanese lunch. Lastly, the tour move on to Kinkakuji or the Golden Pavillion, with it's gold-plated roof, it has become the landmark of Kyoto and the quintessential must-see attraction of the city. After a full day of sightseeing, you will return to Osaka by bus. Itinerary: 8:40 - Umeda Pickup: Hearton Hotel Nishiumeda 9:00 - Namba Pickup: Namba OCAT 10:00 - Arrival to Kyoto 10:00 - Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine 11:30 - Arashiyama 13:50 - Randen Train from Arashiyama Station to Shijo Omiya Station 14:11 - Bus Ride from Shijo Omiya Station to Kinkakuji Temple 14:40 - Kinkakuji Temple 15:55 - Drop off at Kyoto station 16:55 - Drop off at Namba OCAT 17:10 - Drop off at Hearton Hotel Nishiumeda ***This is not a guided tour, however a tour operator that can speak English will be on board.
strTitle: Enjoy a full day bus and train tour of Kyoto from Osaka

strIntroduction: I will guide you around Tokyo's most famous spot places during this one day trip. Following a pick-up at your hotel, we will buy a "One Day Pass" ticket at a subway station for only 1000 JPY (not included in the price of this tour). We will visit Tukiji fish market where we will have breakfast. Then to Tokyo Skytree, a 634-meter-high tower that offers commanding views over Tokyo. Then, we will move to Sensoji, an old temple founded in 628 AD in Asakusa, one of Tokyo’s favorite entertainment districts, where you can have a delicious sushi lunch. After lunch we will stroll through the inner gardens of the Imperial Palace East Garden, built over the the original site of the Edo Castle, and admire the moats, lawns, and stunning colors of the Japanese trees. We will take the subway and head for Meiji Jingu Shrine, dedicated to Emperor Meiji. You will see many worshipers there. Finally, we will move to the final destination - the Ginza shopping district, known for its boutique sores and major shops of famous designer brands. The tour ends here, so you can carry on shopping on your own, or relax in one of Ginza’s luxury restaurants or trendy coffee shops.
strTitle: Take a one-day trip around the best spots in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this grand tour, you’ll be whisked away to the best high spots of Tokyo!! A full day tour will help you discover the many different sides of this amazing city! All the places are highly recommended places to visit while you are in Tokyo. You can go to these popular places with English guides who are very knowledgeable and happy to answer your questions! They can even help you learn a bit of Japanese. The tour kicks off with panoramic views from Tokyo Tower, which is a symbolic figure of Tokyo. If you are lucky, you’ll be able to see Mt. Fuji!! Then you are going to visit traditional Japanese buildings, such as Sensoji Temple, Meiji Shrine, and the Imperial Palace! All these places will take you back to the old Japan. Along the street to Sensoji, you will enjoy shopping through Nakamise. After that, you’ll be joining the cruise down from Sumida River. In spring, cherry blossoms are in bloom along the river and the scenery is amazing. Also, you will be walking through Tokyo and experience the scenic vista! You can also look forward to lunch! You will have an authentic Japanese lunch with Tempura, Yakitori and other Japanese cuisines. Feel the taste of the old to the new Tokyo! All these amazing spots with this price well make for a grand experience. You won’t regret it.
strTitle: Grand Tour of Tokyo Highlights with English Guide, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Do you like sushi and tempura? Do you know that Japanese cuisine is much richer? You can learn all of that if you come to my kitchen near Ginza and learn to cook healthy Japanese meals prepared by local Japanese mothers. You will be able to cook the dishes when you go back to your home country. We are a group of well-trained English speaking mothers. You will have fun in our Japanese home cooking class. Here are the details of this activity: Our staff will meet you at Toyosu Station at 10:30 am. From there it’s about 12-minute walk to our kitchen. Below is our year-round menu. If your group is more than 3 people, this activity will be private and we will be happy to customize the menu according to your requests. Please feel free to ask when you make a booking. 1) Steamed rice and pickles / Miso soup / Dashimaki-tamago (Japanese-style omelette) Karashiae or goma-ae: Lightly boiled seasonal green vegetables with Japanese mustard sauce or sesame sauce Yaki-zakana: Grilled fish 2) Curry-rice or omu-rice or hayashi-rice (choose one) / Green salad or goma-ae 3) Steamed rice and pickles / Miso soup/ Tonkatsu (breaded pork cutlet) / Cooked vegetables as a side dish 4) Steamed rice and pickles / Miso soup/ Nikujaga (meat stew) / Cooked vegetables as a side dish 5) Do-it-yourself sushi rolls (very good for a party!) Chawan-mushi (an egg custard dish steamed in a bowl) (Please note that you will be asked to pay additional 1000 JPY for the last option, menu number 5) Besides those menus, we prepare other special dishes using seasonal ingredients. For example, takenoko gohan (rice cooked with Bamboo shoots) in spring and green soy beans or Japanese ginger salad in summer. Autumn specials will include takikomi gohan (sort of a Japanese-style pilaf), kuri-gohan (chestnut rice), chawan-mushi, and grilled fish. The winter special will be nabe (a hot pot) cooked on the table.The hot pot is popular as a winter family meal not only because it makes you warm, but also because it has a variety of ingredients such as seafood, meat, tofu, mushrooms, and vegetables. In our class, you will also learn how to make steamed rice in a pan (not an electric rice cooker). Of course, you will learn how to make dashi soup stock in a traditional way. So, let’s start cooking! After cooking, you will enjoy the lunch you made and chat with us!
strTitle: Learn healthy cooking from a Japanese mother near Ginza

strIntroduction: Visit one of famous shopping street (Musashikoyama: 12 minutes from Shibuya, 20 minutes from Shinjuku by train) in Tokyo and enter variety of stores such as drug stores, supermarkets, convenience stores, and small specialized stores. 15:00: Meet at your hotel 16:00: Move to Musashikoyama shopping street 16:00-18:00: Stroll the shopping street 19:00: Go back to your hotel Japanese young women like to visit drug stores to look around and find something new and interesting to buy, while young men like to visit convenient stores 2 times per day and buy their lunch/dinner, snacks, drinks while they pay their bill, withdraw money and so on. On the other hand, older women like to go shopping 4-5 times per week and they are looking for something good for their family, while older men like to visit Pachinko parlors (Game center) to enjoy themselves. Pachinko and Karaoke are Japanese favorite types of entertainment and you can find many of those on the shopping street. You can see and feel the real life of Japanese people and I can explain their habits and attitude since I have been working at a FMCG (Fast Moving Consumer Goods) multi-national company for almost 30 years and was involved in market research. You can find a variety of take-out foods and those are Japanese favorite foods for everyday life. Japanese like to drink after work, as one communication method with their co-workers and there are so many casual drinking restaurant in the area.
strTitle: Shopping tour in Tokyo to understand Japanese consumers

strIntroduction: Let's run together in the center of Tokyo to see Ginza, Tsukiji and Nippon bridge! The run will cover about 12-13 km, and we will have a 2 hour break in between. We will run past Tokyo station, rivers, harbors, Shinto shrines, shopping streets and experience the vibrant charm of Tokyo's downtown. Everybody, from tourists visiting Tokyo for the first time to people living and working in Tokyo, is welcomed to join us on this run! Let's experience running through the center of Tokyo, full of interesting discoveries and surprises!
strTitle: Let's Go Running in the Center of Tokyo, Ginza & Tsukiji!

strIntroduction: To the Japanese, a ninja is neither a spy nor an assassin. The ninja is a person who places a sword on his/her heart to control and discipline him/herself. Ninjas seek to maintain "balance" or peace of mind in life to survive. Our ancestors came to Tokyo over 400 years ago, following a feudal lord named Tokugawa Ieyasu, who founded the Tokugawa Shogunate in 1603. As the Shibatas had loyal ninjas, our ancestors could serve the government as heads of "Onmitsu" ninjas. If you check about your host's great grandfather, Shibata Takenaka, you can see our linage. As our ancestors worked for Tokugawa Shogunate for 265years, you can find some historical documents in libraries and the ministry of foreign affairs, which is rather unique, as most of ninja histories have been kept secret. In our clan we have crafted our weapons for over 400 years. You'll see some of the weapons hand-crafted by your host(ess) and her father. In your session, you will train yourself learning three ninja techniques our novices learn in his/her first class. The activity includes: 1. Ninja experience meditation 2. Change to a ninja outfit 3. Practice Ninja Stars 4 Practice Blowgun 5. Learn Kujikiri (well-wishing) technique 6. Photo-taking time About Meditation: The art of ninjutsu is more than learning the physical skills of the martial arts. It is also about finding your inner self through physical conditioning, meditation, and discipline. With the practice of meditation one develops key elements of increased awareness and detachment while increasing his/her sense of inner peace. It is through meditation that ninjas learn how to reach the "ku" (no-self, void), and to control the energy called "ki" which is the essential life force existing in all things in the universe. In meditation a ninja seeks to get to the "ku no kyochi" (state of no-self) by integrating his/her body and mind. This state of mind gives a ninja the power to block out everything except the task at hand by using a sense of extreme calm and enhanced concentration. About Kujikiri: Kujikiri is a series of nine symbolic hand gestures. It invokes the spiritual and mental strength of an individual. The hand signs are believed to be able to channel energy. The hand signs were taken from the practices of the early Buddhists. They are used to build confidence and strength in the practitioner. They are also believed to enhance one's senses of danger and enable one to foresee death. About weapons: Get a chance to view some of the famous weapons made by our master weapon-smith. *If your requested starting time is after 9pm, or between 6am and 8pm, please pay for the Ninjas' overnight stay fee at the Dojo. You can make the payment by purchasing the "[Add-on] Ninja Overnight Stay Fee" in addition to your experience fee.
strTitle: Be a Ninja: Learn Three Basic Techniques

strIntroduction: The cuisine of Okinawa is famous for the variety that is offers. Okinawa people are famous for Longevity. People say the secret of long life is their traditional cuisine. The characteristics of Okinawa cuisine are mainly used pigs and kelp broth, bonito. Use of the local ingredients such as fresh vegetable and cook different of methods created a spectacular cuisine in Okinawa. In this activity, You can choose 1 of 3 different dishes as follows with a specialty Okinawa vegetable named GOYA. Cook and Try! - Goya Champlung (Scramble egg and Goya, meat) - Goya Salad (Salad made with Goya) - Goya squash (Fresh Juice made with Goya) Learn Okinawa homemade cooking and you can enjoy your favorite Okinawa dishes at home!
strTitle: Cooking Experience Okinawa Cuisine with GOYA

strIntroduction: Make a professional handmade Japanese stone seal by yourself! You’ll get your very own, unique seal. You will be guided in your work by a Japanese stone seal professor. Japanese seals can be made from wood, bamboo, stone, hone, meal or plastics etc. At this event, you’ll make your one and only personal stone seal with stone, which is easy to be sculpted. You will be able to carve what you wish with a stylus, and the craftsman will assist you in carving your nickname in Japanese hiragana or katakana. (It is also possible to carve in kanji, Chinese character, but you need a bigger stone seal for an extra fee) The stone seal acts as a signature in Japan. With the seal you will create during this workshop, you will be able to stamp your business cards, letters, or even works of art! We prepare special small gifts for the guest from FindJPN. Please come and enjoy our event!
strTitle: Craft your own Japanese Stone Seal

strIntroduction: Five reasons to choose Kyoto Fun's Cycling Tour 1. Bicycle is by far the best way to get around Kyoto’s crowded streets. Kyoto has a great geography for two wheels. Why wait for crowded buses or be stuck in traffic with an expensive taxi when you have the freedom to move around at will like the locals do. 2. We take you on scenic routes which are chosen with your safety in mind. Riding a bike alone you might get lost or end up on very narrow streets. We know the best way to get around and give you tips on staying safe. We also know quiet side streets with lots of character and charm. 3.We tell you stories of the city’s past and give you background knowledge along the way. Learn about the world of the shogun and samurai, the geisha house and even get a background on the shinto and buddhist beliefs. Learning about the cultural legacy of old Kyoto is a great insight to Japanese customs and culture. 4. You can choose to join a small group of six max or a private experience. With a maximum of six riders we can be sure to get around more easily and give everyone a more intimate experience. Or for the ultimate in flexibility and customisation choose a private experience and we will go out of our way to take any special requests that you have on board. 5.We don’t just give you a history lesson, we focus on having a fun enjoyable day. Lots of tours offer guides that can rattle off facts figures and dates but are always on a tight time frame. We look at travel a little different. So, if you want a fun day out on the bikes and enjoy the journey as much as the destination, choose this experience and I am sure you will be pleased. Choose from one of three courses or help plan the day with your guide on a private experience. Bike Tour of the West Side of Kyoto Duration: 5-6hrs Distance: 20km Difficulty: Moderate Kinkakuji the "Golden Pavilion" → Genko-An a hidden gem → Kitano-tenmangu an ancient shrine → Kamishichiken Geisha District We make our way across town to Kinkakuji the Golden Pavillion. This is one of the most spectacular sights in Kyoto and a UNESCO World Heritage site with lush gardens and plenty to take in. Next up is a quiet temple off the beaten path called Genko-An. This zen temple has a unique history and is a nice quiet place to look at the beautiful gardens through the two windows, one circular and one square.These represent two views of the world, through the lens of confusion or one of enlightenment. On the way out you can gaze up to the ceiling panels which are made from the blood stained floorboards of a famous castle, put in place to commemorate the samurai who died in battle on that fateful day. After Genko-An we visit one of the most famous shrines in Kyoto, Kitano-tenmangu. This shrine is dedicated to a statesman and scholar who became deified as a god of thunder after his banishment from Kyoto and vengeful return as an angry spirit after death. This place is remarkable for it's many old wooden structures set amongst thousands of plum trees. It is also a place where students pray for good exam results. After that we visit the Kamishichiken Geisha District nearby for a look at the smallest and quietest geisha area. Here we can soak up the classic atmosphere and maybe even see a geisha on her way to work. This tour covers a lot of ground in a day but we can see a lot of the city as we roll past on our bikes. Bike Tour of the South Side of Kyoto Duration: 5-6hrs Distance: 10km Difficulty: Easy Sanjusangendo the 1001 kannon statues → Tofukuji a zen garden → Fushimi Inari the tunnel of red gates → Miyagawa cho geisha district Starting at the magical temple Sanjusangendo, here you have an opportunity to see 1001 kannon statues which were carved way back in 12th and 13th century Japan. This is a place with a lot of history and a real mind blowing experience to wander past these statues made with amazing skill. Then it's on to discover a masterpiece of zen gardening at Tofukuji. This place will take your breath away. There are several gardens to discover with each having a different style. Most impressive is the deep gully spanned by a bridge with dozens of maple trees lining the way. After that we head to Fushimi Inari, possibly one of the most famous and definitely most photographed places in Kyoto. Enjoy a stroll amongst the thousands of red torii gates and feel the magical energy of the place. This is also a place to pray for a good harvest or success in business so bring a few coins to drop in the prayer box and we will show you how to make a wish in the shinto way. Then we head back to the city through Gion and discover quaint neighbourhoods in a special part of Kyoto. Here we also visit the geisha district of Miyagawa cho and enjoy a little look in on the ways of the traditional entertainers in Kyoto. We may even be lucky enough to spot some Geisha or their apprentice Maiko on the way to their next appointment. Bike Tour of the East Side of Kyoto Duration: 5-6hrs Distance: 10km Difficulty: Easy Heian Shrine's spectacular garden → Ginkakuji the "Silver" Pavilion → the Path of Philosophy → Nanzen-ji temple grounds → Gion District Starting at Heian Shrine you get a fantastic introduction to Japanese garden design at the sprawling garden of Heian Shrine. This a a real gem as it's usually not crowded at all so you can stroll the gardens at leisure while we talk about the traditional customs of the old capital. From here it is a short trip to Ginkakuji which has one of the most relaxing and classic Japanese style gardens from the days when the tea ceremony had a huge influence on the culture of Japan. This was a retirement villa for a famous shogun and grandson of the shogun who built the Golden Pavilion across town. Here you can see buildings which are over 500 years old and a masterful display of gardening skill. From there a trip down the Path of Philosophy which is one of the most pleasant paths in Kyoto. Hugging the hills there is an abundance of nature and plenty of little shops and cafes along the route. This takes us to Nanzen Ji temple, one of the great temples of the Zen faith. The grounds here are spectacular and we can even see a Romanesque aqueduct running through the nature filled site. Then it's on to two of the famous streets in Gion called Hanimikoji and Shirakawa Dori. Here you can soak up the atmosphere and maybe even spot a geisha running off to an appointment. One this pleasant day you can see lots of nature, beautiful gardens and get a taste of zen.
strTitle: Kyoto Fun: Cycling Tour

strIntroduction: This is a tour around the World Heritage Mt. Fuji, a source of art for Japanese engravers such as Hokusai or Hiroshige, who are widely known, and many other artists who were inspired by its beautiful shape that can be seen from hundreds of kilometers away. In this tour I will take you to the best spots from where Mt. Fuji can beautifully be seen and end the day in a relaxing hot spring. We will pick you up at your accommodation and depart at 8:30 am. The tour will start from one of the most stunning view points of Mt. Fuji famous for its five-storied pagoda at Arakurasengen Park. We will move to see the pastoral landscape of Oshino Hakkai with old style Japanese houses and a total of eight ponds formed from the beautiful groundwater of Mt. Fuji. The name “Hakkai” meaning eight seas actually represents the ponds that were originally used for cold showering for the pilgrims in the Edo era. We will be taking lunch at a local restaurant. After a 1-hour drive to reach the caldera Lake Ashi, we will go to the top of the 1350-meter high Hakone Mountain by ropeway. Here again the view from the lake and from the top of the mountain are astonishing. We will have a short tea break at an old traditional tea house on the side of an old road that connected Tokyo and Kyoto, called the Tokaido (road of the east sea). The last activity will be refreshing yourself at a modern designed hot spring that I recommend. ※All viewpoints are chosen and been supervised by Mr. Rocky Tanaka, the only professional Mt. Fuji photographer. The picture used on top of the page is one of his work. You can check his works online.
strTitle: See Mt Fuji's stunning view points and experience hot spring

strIntroduction: The two ancient cities, Kyoto and Nara are located far from each other, but it is possible to travel around the famous sightseeing spots in both of these cities in one day. This tour makes it possible for you to visit both of the cities without having the feeling of being rushed. This tour will cover many major tourist spots in Kyoto and Nara in one day! Kyoto was Japan’s capital for over 1,000 years, and the historical scents of Japan still remain. Kyoto has a stunning collection of UNESCO World Heritage sites and also a geisha district. The temples and traditions are outstanding, but the food is also exquisite! Nara is also one of Japan's ancient cities, with many historical sites, located less than one hour from Kyoto. Japan’s first permanent capital was established in the year 710 at Heijo, which has now become Nara. Since it was the first permanent capital, Nara remains as a city with many historical treasures, including the oldest and largest temples in Japan. In this tour, you will visit places in Kyoto and Nara in one day! A local guide will show you around safely, while presenting you with important and interesting information about the historical sites and about the city in general. Why we love it: - Don't have enough time to travel around? No worries! Visit famous sightseeing sites in one day! - You do not worry about changing trains or buses as you travel around Kyoto and Nara since you will get around with your guide! - Take a tour with a knowledgeable English-speaking local guide with years of experience. -Strap on your adventurous spirit and immerse yourself in Kyoto and Nara Regarding itineraries, You can talk to our guide to make the best plan based on your requests since it's a customizable tour. Through the tour,you will be able to visit 3-4 sites in total in Kyoto and Nara. Since this is a one day trip, you can do other activities on the next day! If you would like to visit highlights of Kyoto and Nara in one day, exploring not only Kyoto but also Nara, join our tour and enjoy your stay in Japan! Don’t miss this opportunity! ※Please note that the host may not be able to pick you up at your hotel depending on the location of your hotel even if you book a hotel pick up option. In that case,we will refund for what you paid for the hotel pick up option. Please let us know where you are going to stay when you make a booking. ※Transportation will be using public transportation, such as trains and buses. Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/mDaR4z -https://flic.kr/p/7w3z1c -https://flic.kr/p/e9CCtB -https://flic.kr/p/5D42hM -https://flic.kr/p/ajZtMR -https://flic.kr/p/auTa3c https://flic.kr/p/g9U5yx
strTitle: Explore the historical cities, Kyoto and Nara in 1 day!

strIntroduction: This tour will take you to see the most important attractions of Nagano City and the Yamanouchi area. You will take a scenic route to see the cutest monkeys in the world and afterwards spend time at the temple of Zenkoji and the bustling Nakamise shopping street, as well as having sake tasting experience at the end. Your guide will meet you at Nagano Station at 8:45 am and will lead you to the Yamanouchi region here you get to meet the Japanese snow monkeys. These monkeys are world-famous for their rare habit of bathing in hot springs during winter. When at the Park, the snow monkeys will let you get really close to them for some great photo opportunities. After saying goodbye to the snow monkeys take a stroll along a tranquil forest trail to the lunch cafe. After a delicious lunch you will get back on the road and head to the Zenko-ji Temple. The temple of Zenkoji is famous for holding the first Buddhist statue brought to Japan. This has made the temple an important pilgrimage site with people coming from all over Japan to pray for their place in Buddhist heaven. Zenkoji Temple has a special energy, and welcomes people of all faiths and religions. The temple grounds have many hidden gems to explore, such as the dark tunnel which runs under the temple. Here you can allegedly gain enlightenment if you find the "Key To Paradise". After exploring Zenko-ji Temple, the guide will take you to one of Nagano's most historic sake breweries where you get the opportunity to try several types of sake. Nagano is one of the regions in Japan with a very active production of sake. Clean spring water in combination with a climate suitable for rice production creates the optimal environment for high quality sake. You can find yourself a good souvenir at Nagano's beloved sake brewery. You will be taken back to Nagano Station where the tour concludes at 17:00. Tour Itinerary: 08:45 Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit. 10:00 Welcome to the Snow Monkey area! Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around. 12:15 Have delicious lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park! 13:00 Leave the lunch restaurant and get taken to the historically important Zenko-ji Temple. 14:15 See the sights of the Zenko-ji Temple and learn of the interesting facts. Enjoy up to 30 minutes of shopping on Nakamise Street. 16:00 Visit a sake brewery and enjoy tasting different types of sake! 16:45 Get on the bus and arrive back to Nagano station by 17:00.
strTitle: 1-Day Tour in Nagano: Snow Monkeys, Zenkoji Temple and Sake

strIntroduction: Ever since the Edo period for over 400 years, “buyo”, a type of traditional dance in Japan, has existed thanks to people who can still dance this traditional art and successfully pass it on. "Buyo" involves dancers stamping their feet and making huge hand/body gestures while twisting and turning to music that can be best described as traditional pop music. In this activity, you’ll... • Watch a “buyo” performance by a successor of this tradition with an interpreter who will give you English explanations. With explanations, you will fully experience and enjoy the essence of “buyo”. When you visit Japan, come and see an exceptional and traditional Japanese performance.
strTitle: Watch a Japanese “Buyo” (Dance) Performance

strIntroduction: Reiki originates from Japan and is a popular hands-on-healing that is well known globally. A treatment feels like a wonderful glowing radiance that flows through and around you. Reiki treats the whole person including body, emotions, mind and spirit creating many beneficial effects that include relaxation and feelings of peace, security and well being. Some of the Health Benefits from Reiki ★ Complete relaxation ★ Release of stress and anxiety ★ Positive emotional states ★ A release of old blocked emotions ★ Pain relief ★ A strengthened immune system ★ Open your intuitive centers ★ Enhance learning ★ Eliminate emotional, physical and mental stress ★ Help overcome past trauma A Reiki healing is very simply performed. The Reiki Practitioner (healer) serves as a channel by placing her hands upon you for the energy to flow. The client remains fully clothed and the session can take place with the client lying down. A Reiki treatment feels like a wonderful glowing radiance that flows through and around you. The energy flows wherever it is required and can normally be felt as a warm sensation or tingling in the body. Reiki treats the whole person including body, emotions, mind and spirit creating many beneficial effects that include relaxation and feelings of peace, security and well being. Receiving Reiki is a very relaxing and soothing experience. Sessions usually last approximately one hour.
strTitle: Reiki Healing Sessions

strIntroduction: Furano Cheese Factory is one of the most popular places for production of cheese in Furano, Hokkaido. The northern Japanese island is widely known for its rich quantities of milk and industrial production of butter and cheese. In fact, Hokkaido's cheese is considered to be one of the finest and will satisfy even the most demanding tastes. At the Furano Cheese Factory you can see the process of making the local camembert cheese behind large windows. Furthermore the place boasts the production of ice-creams with unique tastes including sweet corn and black squid ink. There is also a pizza bar where you can try locally made pizza cooked in an old-fashioned furnace. The highlight of Furano Cheese Factory however are the hands-on experiences offered in the workshop. You can learn how to make your own butter, ice-cream, cheese and bread! Due to the popularity of the place and the limited availability of the classes, prior reservation is necessary in order to take part in the hands-on activities. We will make a reservation for you and will secure your place in the classes offered. You will be able to pay the small class fee when you arrive. The local staff will be expecting you and in some cases (such as the bread making workshop) they will have completed the necessary preparations of the dough. The following schedule shows the times of the classes: - Butter making: 9:15, 10:15, 11:15, 13:15, 14:15, 15:15 You will make 60 gram of butter. The class takes about 40 minutes. - Ice-cream making: 9:15, 10:15, 11:15, 13:15, 14:15, 15:15 You will make 100 gram of butter. The class takes about 40 minutes. NOTE: Please note that at least 4 people are necessary for this class to be held! - Cheese making: 9:30, 11:00, 13:30, 15:00 You will make 100 gram of cheese. The class takes about 60 minutes. - Bread making: 10:00, 13:30 You will make about 6 pieces of bread. The class takes about 90 minutes. NOTE: *Please note that at least 2 people are necessary for this class to be held! *Please note that the reservation for bread making has to be made before three days in advance. Note that in the winter months (November-March) the 15:15 classes are not held. Don't miss your chance to participate in Hokkaido's best known hands-on workshops and don't rely on availability without a prior reservation! We will help you arrange these unique activities during your trip to Hokkaido!
strTitle: Make cheese, butter and ice-cream at Furano Cheese Factory!

strIntroduction: This is a two hour morning walking tour in the famous Yanaka district. If you want to know what real authentic life in Tokyo was like, you must visit Yanaka district. In this tour, we explore the town, visit beautiful and non-touristy temples and shrines, see old streets, and visit a lovely cafe at the end. Yanaka is a very rare area as it didn't get much damage from the war and from the big earthquake in the 1920s. You can see pretty streets and houses, as well as local temples and shrines. We will meet up at Nippori Station at 10:00 am, and walk to Yanaka cemetery, which was founded in 1872 and where many famous people such as the last shogun of the Edo period, Tokugawa Yoshinobu, were buried. Walking around a cemetery may sound a little strange but it is actually open to visitors, and you can also learn how Buddhism developed in Japan. By the cemetery is Tennoji Temple, one of the oldest temples in the town which has a giant Buddha statue in it. It is a very quiet local temple and not touristy at all, so you might feel the different atmosphere from other major temples such as Sensoji in Asakusa. Then we will walk in the downtown area of Yanaka, where you can have a glimpse of the real lifestyle in Japan. There are not so many big chain stores and instead you will see a lot of unique independent shops, cafes, bakeries and restaurants, as well as local temples. Finally, we will explore Yanaka Ginza, a lovely shopping street in the heart of the town. If you would like to look for some small gifts for your family or friends, I would say this is the best place. And if you are a cat lover, it will be even more exciting because there are plenty of cats in the area! We will finish the tour at about 12:00 at either Yanaka Ginza or JR Nippori (or subway Sendagi) station.
strTitle: Yanaka Morning Tour with a Licensed Guide in Tokyo

strIntroduction: If you've come to Tokyo in winter and you're disappointed that there's no snow anywhere around the city, this day trip is exactly for you! Just an hour ride away lies a breathtaking snowy landscape with some of the country's best ski slopes and skiing facilities. You can easily have a break from the big megapolis and enjoy outdoor activities or simply play in the powder-like snow. For lovers of hot springs, there's a popular spa resort as well! This self-guided tour includes: - round-trip Shinkansen (bullet train) ticket to Gala-Yuzawa resort (Gala-Yuzawa Station) - 1-day of unlimited rides on the main lift and gondola - a discount if you'd like to take a 2-hour ski lesson for beginners (held in Japanese only) This tour is only available until March 31. The lift and gondola can be used from 8:00 to 17:00 every day. The discount prices for the ski lessons are as follows (need to be paid separately on the day, from the Cheers counter in the upper gondola station): Adult, weekday: 2590 JPY, weekend: 2960 JPY Child, weekday: 3500 JPY, weekend 4000 JPY The lessons take place between 10:00 and 12:00 and between 13:15 and 15:15 every day. For your reference, the average price of ski/snowboard set rentals for one adult is: Half day: 3700 JPY Full day: 5200 JPY The average price for snow wear set rental is: Half day: 2100 JPY Full day: 3000 JPY
strTitle: Ski day trip to one of the best ski resorts, Gala Yuzawa!

strIntroduction: Ishigaki island is a treasure trove of colorful coral reefs and tropical fish. Snorkeling and diving is the best way to immerse yourself in this aquatic wonderland. You might even have a chance to see manta rays during the season! This introduction diving course will teach you the basics of diving. Available for beginner, above 10 years old. You will received a CD with the amazing photos taken during your dive to bring home as a special souvenir. 8:30AM Meet up at the dive shop. 9:00AM Depart to the diving spot by boat. -1st Point: Trial dive at Coral reef (Half day course will go back to the shop 11:30) -2nd Point: Manta point (One-day course will enjoy snorkeling) (Discover dive course will enjoy 2nd trial diving) 13:00PM Go back to the dive shop. -Lunch time. 15:00PM Go back to hotel. *Transportation service available for one day course. (Reservation required) *Half day course are not going to Manta Point, please join one day course to see Manta rays.
strTitle: Try an Introduction Diving Course! - in Ishigaki Island
